Reviews.Title: “You can book with confidence at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nancy e
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Delta Centre-Ville during the week following Easter. The location was paramount as we planned to take advantage of the bus/metro and do a lot of walking. Old Montreal, Ste Catherine St and the underground shopping maze, as with the Metro, was within walking distance. We were extremely well received by Gabrielle at the front desk. She welcomed us in both official languages. She inquired about our stay and was ready with information to help us enjoy our visit. We mentioned we had left Montreal 32 years ago and were celebrating an anniversary by playing tourist on this trip. We stayed on the 15th floor. We never waited for the elevator. We had a nice view, but more importantly to us, our room was very clean, neat and very quiet. The bed was comfortable and we slept well. Housekeeping brought water and chocolates in the evening. A nice touch. Gaby and the staff made our stay very memorable by their gestures. We were presently surprised with a food tray after a long day of sightseeing. This thoughtful action was truly appreciated. We will definitely go back and highly recommend this hotel. Also behind the hotel on Victoria Square is the "voted the best fish and chips restaurant Brit & Chips". Do not miss this one.

Reviews.Title: “Room need some work..”
Reviews.Author: XxcorinnexX
Reviews.Content: I stay for a night with my mom in March..and we had a Delta room (basic). It need some work, but I know they are planning on doing a lot of work in the room soon..That's a good thing! TV was ''old'' and bathroom also need some upgrade compared to other Delta. But our stay was great, and location is perfect if you need to be downtown or even Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value - great service”
Reviews.Author: Guywilltravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the Easter long weekend - 2 rooms - a couple with two adult children. Unlike what I have read in other reviews, our check-in was smooth and efficient without any delays. Staff were courteous, helpful and very responsive to our requests. The daily housekeeping was excellent. Parking was expensive which is what you come to expect in Montreal. We had no issue getting an extended check out which was very much appreciated. We had Sunday brunch in the Hotel. The food and service was outstanding and very convenient, but it did not represent good value. Would we stay in this hotel again - ABSOLUTELY.

Reviews.Title: “So far, the best hotel in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Stacy-Ann M
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was on point. Our room was spacious, clean and completely upgraded into something more modern. With all the smoke meat and poutine we ate, the gym was a God sent. Thereâ€™s very little to complain here, but I guess everyone has a different experience. Hopefully, if the price is right for the next long weekend, we will definitely give this hotel another try.

Reviews.Title: “Reservation - Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Rod S
Reviews.Content: Gaby, at the Front Desk, exemplifies what I look for in the business world - someone who goes out of their way to make sure the customer is treated with respect. I will continue to stay at the Delta because of this "top notch" service.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the discount price we payed. There are better priced hotels than this one. Won't be returning here.”
Reviews.Author: bubbletrails
Reviews.Content: It was a fairly nice looking hotel in some parts, but it lacked alot of amenities. Our room was abit outdated, a couple power outlets were out, no fridge, blood spots on the blanket. You had to pay for wireless in your room,but if you went to the lobby it was free. The restaurant & bar were way too overpriced, so we ate out intstead. Parking underground was $24/night. On a postive note, the staff was very helpful when we first arrived, beds were super comfortable & the hotel was close to Rue St.Catherine & Old Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Reservations-visit in May, no stay yet”
Reviews.Author: wcottawa
Reviews.Content: We haven't stayed here yet but our first experience with reservations was a little disappointing. We had signed up for a tripjaunt and were hoping to coordinate it with a via rail special. The server was down and we could not check availability for the weekend we wanted, then when Delta's server was up The 2 weekends we wanted weren't available. Having voiced that, the people we spoke to were friendly--but unable to help us find out available dates for the jaunt. Now reviewing the site I hope we don't end up with a room requiring renovation on a date that was our third choice. I hope we have a good experience-we live in Ottawa and hope to visit Montreal more often as our chief travel destination. We use hotel points so if we like our stay we will return!

Reviews.Title: “typical chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: xergiu
Reviews.Content: This is a typical chain hotel you won't remember after your visit. Nothing wrong with it, clean and comfortable but non-descriptive and void of character with the single exception of the non-rectangular shape of rooms and the design of the swimming pool. My room had plenty of earth colors, black and white pictures with musical instruments and a good view. For this review I have opened the cabinet to see the TV and yes, that one was old. Not to worry to much, at the reception I noticed a rendering of future room renovation coming soon. There is wired internet for $12/day in the rooms and wireless in the lobby. Glass elevators on one side allow views of Montreal. For vacationers, I would recommend a boutique hotel instead. However, business people would like the Delta hotel because it is close to Old Montreal, Financial District, subway etc. and has good meeting rooms, large lobby, its own restaurants plus proximity to night clubs with surprises for depressed US sales execs.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay in 5 months, loved my renovated room”
Reviews.Author: LakeviewGuy
Reviews.Content: After staying here in September for the half-marathon, I decided to go with this hotel again as I loved the location, price, and bed comfort. My only qualm last stay was that the rooms were in dire need of an upgrade. I stayed on the 24th floor in a recently--I think they said one week before I checked in--renovated room with a king-size bed. The decor, while not extraordinary, was nicely updated in a modern color palette. The king size bed was amazingly comfortable, and the new desk setup with the power strip, cables and ethernet for free wifi was a nice touch. The bathroom was also nicely updated and the shower was great. The room and my floor was quiet and I had no trouble sleeping. I again loved this hotel for the location as you can access the "underground city" through the back side of the restaurant and it's a short walk from the Square Victoria Metro stop. The Old Port area is also a short walk. The recent room renovation really helps. The common areas, however, while in good shape and clean, are dated and could use a bit more of an updating to better match the new rooms. Maybe I'm just picky but I like to see some coordination. Finally, there was also some kind of college event going on, and a few of the lower floors were hit pretty hard with a loud, drunk crowd and booming music, but I was so many floors above that it didn't bother me. I just wonder if they considered the comfort of guests who were on lower floors closer to the music, as I could hear it up the elevator shaft for a few floors as I ascended. It was a bit annoying sharing the elevator with drunk kids a few times, but I think it was just one night and there wasn't an incident that really bothered me. I just hope they consider other guests when they allow bookings of this type. Nonetheless, this is my second stay in less than 5 months, and I definitely plan on staying here a third time in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for family”
Reviews.Author: Famillesabord
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best one in downtown Montreal if you travel with kids. indoor pool, small kids room, lots ofspace in rooms and gifts and games for them. The turning restaurant on highest floor of hotel is very exciting and the food is good. Reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “central location”
Reviews.Author: tiatatravelagent
Reviews.Content: Nice central location downtown Montreal, great mid-range property, price can be steep in the summer. Ask for high floor, than you have a nice view of the area. Reception area can be busy and as a platinum + member, Took me over 10 minutes to check-in via the priority lane.

Reviews.Title: “Each stay is worse than previous one.”
Reviews.Author: teeceeTO
Reviews.Content: I had sworn this hotel off for business given my previous visit last year. Unfortunately, my hotel of choice was booked up, so I thought I'd try Delta Centreville again. I was booked into a "Premium" room. Room 2419. As soon as I got off the elevator, all I could smell was carpet glue. So you'd think the carpet would look new? Nope. Full of dust and debris. The room looks like it had been updated, but mostly lipstick on the pig. Room also smelled. Turning on the light in the hallway/closet made the most horrible noise (you know that flourescent bulb flicker/buzz noise??). Oh, and the closet door wouldn't close properly, so it was permanently ajar, making it hard to get into the bathroom. TV remote didn't work. Had to call for a blow dryer. No mini bar. Housekeeping walked right in around 6:30 (they knocked, but didn't give me enough time to answer before barging in) to drop off chocolate and water. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, well-run business hotel”
Reviews.Author: aquatik
Reviews.Content: This hotel is impeccable, with friendly, helpful staff, making it an excellent downtown business hotel. A short walk from the train station and from charming Old Montreal, this hotel is also well-located in the business centre of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...Rooms require Renos”
Reviews.Author: L E
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, Saturday Night, using a "Dealfind" present from our daughter for our anniversary. The location is excellent, as it is close to the underground shopping network, and close to Old Montreal. The rooms really need to be renovated. The carpet had a red stain on it (not sure from what), the sink was cracked, the tub was painted and the paint was peeling (the plugs didn't work for either) and we had to put the coffee machine on the floor close to a plug that worked and it took forever to perk. The ceiling was black around the air conditioning vent. We also had to call front desk to have the duvet replaced since there was no stuffing left in it. The "Dealfind" voucher was for a premier room (which should be $135.00), but the price of our room was $119.00 which I think was the regular Delta room, we were on the 16th floor (don't know which floor the premier rooms start at). We handed our "Dealfind" voucher on check-in and on check-out they charged our credit card full price for the room, and parking (which by the way is pretty expensive $24.00/day) I looked at my bill and noticed this so had to have them adjust it or I would have paid twice. The front desk staff apologized and ended up giving us free parking for the trouble. Overall I loved how close the hotel was to everything, but it definitely needs to be renovated. The staff was very friendly as well. Stayed 24 March 2012

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: makeupaddict
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early March for a business trip because it was next door to the office and because my boss was also staying here. My premier King room was really very comfortable. It was on a higher floor with floor to ceiling windows overlooking the city. The bed was extremely comfortable. In fact, I would say it's one of the most comfortable hotel beds I've had. The shower was powerful and with adjustable temperature. There was a coffee maker in the room which was nice but only one sachet of coffee was provided. The other sachet was decaf. Besides the coffee, a tea bag and another camomile tea bag were provided. Internet was free with the room but it was not wireless. It was stable though and I had no problems with the connection. It was a short walk to Ste Catherine. All in, a comfortable and convenient hotel for my stay. Having said that, there were a few shortcomings. The breakfast could be more varied. The choices were basically the same throughout my 9-night stay. Compared to Asian hotels, this hotel came up short in terms of not giving free bottles of water, more toiletries (a disposable shower cap would have been appreciated) and more choices of tea/coffee in the room. Visitors should also bear in mind that the area in which the Delta Centre-Ville is located basically shuts down after 5 pm as it's in the business district. The Delta Montreal is more suitably located in terms of amenities such as shopping and dining. As other reviewers have said, the TV is old and most channels are in French. Very limited for the English speaking guest. Service was fairly friendly and efficient. Apparently, there are better hotels nearby such as the Inter-Continental and the Westin. But I wouldn't mind staying here again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Location, but Room Renos Required”
Reviews.Author: NiagaraMarmiton
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights last weekend. Room was very tired. With an old tv, lots of bruises on the furniture, and a bathroom with no towel racks. The door frame looked like someone had tried to kick the door down. Beds were comfortable, and the fitness room was great. The pool looked very nice. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Parking was a maze, and full the second night. Location is excellent. Returning for a conference at the end of May, and I really hope we get a renovated room. Apparently, renovations are underway.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Danthemannad
Reviews.Content: Real nice hotel downtown Montreal. Stayed twice at this hotel for a business trip. Closed to Place Bonaventure. This hotel has a great view while in the elevator. I was staying on one of the upper level. Had a great view of the city. Also the restaurant in the lobby is really good for their breakfast and meal as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: theofficeflan
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much due to the reviews here, but when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised. The lobby is very nice, and the rooms weren't bad either. My boyfriend and I stayed in the cheapest room, and everything was very nice and clean. The beds are insanely comfortable. We had floor to ceiling windows with a beautiful view. The location is good too, just a 15 minute walk to Catherine Street. Some aspects could be improved on (the old school TV), but overall it is a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: Go2Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Delta Centre-ville on March 1-2, 2012 while travelling on business. I got a great group rate ($129) on a standard room with king bed, desk, TV and arm chair. The room was quiet and clean, completely acceptable and comfortable but nothing to write home about. I would like to compliment the front desk staff, however. Check-in was friendly and efficient and when, upon check-out, I expressed my disappointment at being charged for a very dissatisfying lunch in one of the hotel restaurants, it was quickly credited off my bill without a fuss. Overall, a good experience. I'd consider staying again when next in Montreal although the location is a bit remote from shopping/dining/night life for a pleasure trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, needs work”
Reviews.Author: GVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Delta Centre-Ville is in an excellent location. It is connected to the underground network and the Bourse Tower, and close to Old Montreal. It is a good value, but the rooms really need spruced up. It's time to update the carpets, paint and fixtures. No room safes? It's 2012 already. I wouldn't mind staying there again if the price was right. It was clean enough and service was very good, but it is past its best before date.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very clean”
Reviews.Author: barbaradave
Reviews.Content: Nice place but is in need of the scheduled renovations. You can tell by the design of the lobby, halls and rooms that it was cutting edge when it was built but now it's just dated. Delta knows this and renovations are slated for this spring and coming from the hospitality industry I know how expensive they are. Everything was very clean everywhere we went and that's probably most important. We had a king beded room at the end of a floor and the layout was wonderful. We did have a problem charging the iPad though, after some testing we found the light switch at the door had to be on to get power to some of the outlets, a little odd but no big deal. Wifi is only available in the lobby and there is a charge for cabled internet in the room. Be careful with the TV remote, we were charged 19.95 for a movie at check-out that we didn't watch, I may have pressed the wrong button by mistake while trying to figure out the remote, at 19.95 per movie it's a sure bet not many guests are watching them. We also found the buffet breakfast somewhat expensive at 21.95 but the fruits etc where very fresh and good, the hot food was good but quite plain for the price. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fair”
Reviews.Author: wilder79
Reviews.Content: Great service at the front desk and good location for anyone who wants to discover Montreal. Our room was fine but the bathroom needed some update (I saw a poster confirming that bathrooms renovation was coming in spring 2012). I found the hotel underground parking lot very small. Overall, happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Centre-Ville - Very Good”
Reviews.Author: AMD3523
Reviews.Content: 10 mins to Old Montreal, 15 mins to shopping area, 5 mins to metro at Victoria Square and 5 mins to palais de congress. Staff pleasant and welcoming in hotel. Underground walkway connecting the hotel to the convention centre and underground city. Used this walkway early one morning going to the convention centre and it was a bit eerie. No one about and not well signed - easy to get lost. If the weather is good walk above ground that way you don't get lost! Stayed the week after the F1 Gp and there was some motor racing memorabilia in the hotel shop though not a wide selection at this stage. Wi Fi available in room at a cost. Also 2 or 3 computer terminals and printers in reception. These are very useful for printing out boarding passes etc. Would I stay here again. Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in general, Room a bit old”
Reviews.Author: Jiabao
Reviews.Content: The room did seem very old - the ceiling is those woolen stick kind of thing and the floor mat seems very old too. The TV was not a digital TV. It was those old CRT TV(!!), which actually amused me for a second if anything. Needless to say the screen size is very small so it's not really an enjoyment to watch any program on it when you are lying on bed. Aside from the fact that it's very old, everything else is fine. Front desk actually was very nice and extended my check out to 6pm when I asked them in the morning, which turned out to be very helpful that we still have a place to rest for an hour or two.before we drive back to Toronto after a day's tiring walk around the Old Montreal. They allow you to leave your car in the garage until 6pm even after you check out, which is very convenient too in some cases. Location is great. Ten minutes walking distance from Old Montreal. Mattress and pillow are very comfy. Room had temperature controlled heater. Had coffee machine. Washroom was big. One last thing though is that the underground parking is somewhat confusing. Just keep in mind to find a spot in P1 or P2 because P3 is no longer hotel parking area. After you enter P3 there's no turning back, you have to leave the garage and come back in.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation in progress”
Reviews.Author: preconnect
Reviews.Content: We spent the week end in Montreal for a junior ice hockey tournament. Hotel location convenient, but the property is in need of renovation, which is in progress. We stayed on an older floor which included outdated amenities and peeling wallpaper. Also, park at your own risk both on street and in hotel garage. SUVs will not fit in garage.

Reviews.Title: “Renovation will make the difference”
Reviews.Author: tripfoodie18
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend and expected that the rooms would be tired but our room was better than we expected. At first glance, due to the bed, bedding and cleanliness, it looked OK but at closer look, the furniture was in bad shape and the bathroom was very clean but the fixtures were out of date. The staff, location and atmosphere of the hotel were all very good so once the renovations are complete, it will be an excellent hotel

Reviews.Title: “Outdated for price”
Reviews.Author: Dabala
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay at this hotel 2-4 times a year on business. I keep wondering when we will be lucky enough to get one of the new updated rooms, especially since we are returning guests?? Who do they save them for? Again, our room looked worn out, there was mold around the tub, black dirt on the ceiling by the venting, and no fan in the bathroom. Check-in is always fast and easy. We stayed two nights, as always, and didnt want any cleaning staff in our room until after we checked out. We kept the "do not disturb" sign on the door and the staff were respectful of this and didnt bother us. This trip I finally had the opportunity to use the gym and pool facilities. I was disappointed that there was no working hand sanitizer in the gym. The equipment is good, the pool was wonderful, and the sauna perfect. The location for this hotel is minutes from the train station, and a 7-10 minute walk to all the amazing shops and restaurants. This is the main reason why we keep returning. This hotel in my opinion is over priced, and its frustrating to see taxes upon taxes when your final bill arrives under your door.

Reviews.Title: “Really good”
Reviews.Author: UlixesHE
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay it was quite good and I would certainly go again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Raj D
Reviews.Content: I was booked into this hotel for a two night stay through Priceline. The staff provided us with excellent service the minute we stepped into the hotel. The room that we has was very nice, clean and spacious. The location of the hotel was very convenient as it is close to the Place Bonaventure (the station for VIA rail). I would definitely stay at this hotel again when visiting Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “The Delta Centre-Ville met our expectations and more...”
Reviews.Author: butchartd
Reviews.Content: I had read the reports on this Delta Hotel which highlighted its excellent location, ample facilities, and, according to many -- good service. So it wasn't really a surprise to myself or my other friends in our travelling group that we had such a superb time this past weekend. We upgraded our room to one on the 26th floor for $20 more and it was well worth it. What a fantastic view of the water and Old Montreal (through the massive floor to ceiling window)! Moreover, the room was very clean. A special thanks to Fannie at the front desk for her efforts to enhance our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff at this hotel have disgusting attitudes”
Reviews.Author: kmgreene
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband are currently staying in this hotel (I'm so annoyed by everything so far, that I'm writing my review before the trip has even ended). Firstly, checking in to this hotel is a nightmare. The staff are rude and slow and they generally only have one person on the desk. The rooms in this hotel are terrible. TV's are so old and they only give you two towels in the bathroom. Breakfast is extremely expensive and it isn't even nice, leaving you feeling totally ripped off. Both myself and my husband were up working late and asked for extra coffee and milk which was brought up to the room straight away. That was fine except that the next morning, the cleaner decided to take everything away from us again. Finally, I had a misplaced key which turns out that my husband found it outside and handed it to reception. We realised what had happened in the space of a few minutes. I went to reception and was met with a passive aggressive woman that asked me for ID to which I responded, it was in my room that we were currently locked out of. Huffing and puffing at my request, she made a call and instructed me to go to my door and security would see me in. My husband then discovered that he had handed my lost key into reception moments earlier to the same staff member. Security came, let me in and confirmed my ID. My husband decided to go down to reception and explain what happened but was gone for a long time so I followed him down. He was still in a line up waiting to be seen. I joined him when we were called and the same woman just looks at us as says "ID" to which I explained that I just showed it to security and I certainly wasn't standing in a line for another 20 minutes to show her. At that point I had the other key card in my hand. At this point she threw her pen down, huffed and puffed again and disappeared from the counter. Returning a few minutes later, she issued our second card again. I told her that i didnt like the way she approached the problem and that her attitude was deplorable. At this point she gave me even more attitude so I just turned and walked away. Finally she shouted after me "have a good day" in the most sarcastic way she could. I am truly disgusted and this is my first time to ever write a review online regarding a hotel stay but never in my life have I had such a bad experience and I will let everyone know. My advise to this hotel is to keep people like this off your front desk as they are the face of your business and give the first and lasting impression of your establishment. I will never return to this hotel or any other Delta hotels and I urge people not to give this hotel their hard earned money and to find somewhere where you will be treated with the consideration and respect a consumer deserves.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more but fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: ubergirlcanada
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, close to everything. Staff was pleasant and the building was very appealing, with the glass exterior elevators. Never had to time to use the facilities, but they looked beautiful and functional. Room was large and had a fantastic view, clean and well kept. Bed was comfortable. Disappointed in the lack of wifi, which was my own fault for not checking. We need more than 1 computer access that it was only hardwired for one computer. TV was from the stone ages, 20" tube TV. I really expected more in this regard, this is not an inexpensive location and frankly never even imagined that it would not have a flat screen TV. Live and Learn.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay, great customer service”
Reviews.Author: MelWtravels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband on Jan 27-28. We were looking for a quiet relaxing weekend to recharge (we have a VERY active 2 yr old who doesn't sleep at night). We were in room 2832 which was very spacious and nice and clean, and quite updated which was great. The first night was wonderful but the second night we only slept for 2 hours after having to deal with a group of people having a party in the next room. We called security who ended up coming 3 times and I believe finally evicting the guests (but only at 6am which is when we finally fell asleep!) I know it's not necessarily the hotel's fault for how their guests behave (they can't screen all the guests before they check in that's for sure) but I still sent the management a letter this morning letting them know that I was disappointed since we were paying guests who didn't get the experience we were expecting. Two hours later I received an email with an appology and an offer for a complimentary night's stay in a suite with breakfast. I have to say that despite the rough night, I am pleased to see how fast and curteous management has been in dealing with this. I have stayed in Delta hotels many times and have never had problems before and will most likely continue going to them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms... Great view”
Reviews.Author: justyna5
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a Premium king room 19th floor. Room was small. Awesome view, comfortable bed. Bathtub/shower looked like it had mold in the grout, wall paper was coming off in the bathroom. Location was awesome! Parking expensive 24$/night.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: kagome999
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights, great value because I got a deal through travelzoo. Location - great location, a few minutes walking distance to VIA rail station and metro station, all accessible through the underground path Room - was a bit worried initially because my room is right next to the elevator, but it was very quiet and had no issues with noise. The room itself has a bit of wear and tear, but very comfortable and spacious. The bed was very comfortable!! Amenities - had swimming pool, gym, restaurants, room service Service - great front desk service, very helpful answering my questions. Was very accommodating with giving me a later check-out time when I requested it! Overall, great place to stay and I would return

Reviews.Title: “Great location, restaurant service subpar”
Reviews.Author: KyleWard
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location, and even better is that its connected to the RESO, so you don't need to venture outside on those cold days to get to the Metro station. The room is a little tired, and in need of a reno, but there are signs in the hotel that this is to happen in Spring of 2012, so that's a plus. Was a signature guest, so had access to the lounge on the 30th floor, this was well stocked, and on par with other delta signature lounges, has a fantastic view of the city as well. Unfortunatly the lounge was closed on our last day at the hotel so we were given cupons to use at the resto in the lobby for Breakfast. We arrived, and stood in line three other parties arrvied after us and were seated before us. When the 3rd was being seated we asked the host if we would be acknowledged and able to eat as well. To which his reponse was "Its not written anywhere who was first" - WOW... Well if you are unsure the best option would be to ASK who was first and not just assume. The buffet breakfast was very picked over, dirty and not well stocked. Highly disapointing to have this on our check out day. I am a Delta Hotel guest quite often, and had never had such a rude comment from an employee. I am HIGHLY looking forward to the survey email they usually send out after checkout.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: kingston007
Reviews.Content: Spent an evening at this hotel. The staff very welcoming especially to kids, and were very helpful with directions and suggestions. Our room was clean and the warm underground parking was appreciated on a - 25 January night. Pricing is what you expect in a downtown city, this hotel's location is perfect for walking to most places. Overall a great stay, we will return!

Reviews.Title: “Most Fabulous 360o View of Montreal Downtown & Skyline”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELAGENTCHECKING
Reviews.Content: The Delta Hotel on 777University Ave & StJacques has great Concierge rooms with access to an amazing Lounge that offers tranquility , ability to see the whole city , west, north to the mountain, south to the river and beyond, as well as an aerial view of OldMontreal, rare. Attached to the Subway and the Underground it is easy to get around from here, dining out on McGill Street is steps away. Abundant Breakfasts & Decent Lunches offered in the first floor Bar or Restaurant at the Delta.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gucci85
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. It was walking distance to all the main attractions and could walk underground to the metro station. Breakfast was exensive, just like most hotels. We enjoyed the indoor pool and the glass elevator! Rooms are nice and clean, I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - nothing major!”
Reviews.Author: MrsL8281
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Montreal for New Year's Eve. We thought the price for the hotel was reasonable so we decided to stay here. Aside from the insane amount of teenagers, the hotel was quite nice. The rooms are outdated but comfy and the view is amazing (we were on the 16th floor). Unfortunately, the teenage hormones that be, when we came out of our room, there were potatoe chips, pop cans, and a broken light fixture in our hallway which wasn't cleaned up for about two days. Guess staff were on holidays? It got loud with kids slamming doors and yelling but they must've ran to their own floor or something after. I thought what was great was the security of the building on New Year's Eve. Anyone without a wrist band and cleared with ID was unable to enter the hotel. Loved that! The amount of kids that got turned away was priceless and most likely best for liability reasons. Anyway, no free breakfast, restaurant seemed pricey and hotel parking is a bit of a pain as you have to circle around the building to get in (all one way streets surround the hotel). It's about $20 a day (don't quote me) with in and out privileges which we liked. I LOVED how close the hotel was to EVERYTHING. Dominoes Pizza and pharmacy across the street, Montreal Eaton Centre and tons of shopping about a 5-10 minute walk, clubbing district only a $10 cab ride (with tip) and Old Montreal, about a 10 min walk as well. Their underground PATH system is easy to get to as it connects directly with the hotel so on those really cold days, we just walked underground. Overall, the hotel is NOT a dump. It's a decent hotel and close to tons of amenities. If you're not picky and only want a clean room to lay your head at night, then this place is it!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay of my life”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugs613
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to stay near Old Montreal for a weekend getaway! We travel alot and have enjoyed many delta hotels in the past, we were shocked! When we entered the hotel we were surrounded by teenagers, there was a breakaway tours group staying at the hotel that weekend. When we checked in we made it clear that we did not want to be near them, that we were looking for a quiet weekend in. That evening was a nightmare, we didnt end up going to bed until 5 am because of the constant disturbances. Clearly they had not followed our request and put us on a party floor, even with our constant complaints to the front desk security did nothing. Our second evening was the same, only the welcomed addition of fire alarms going off! Two days and we got no sleep! Besides the loud and distrubing crowd that was there we had the following: - Very small 18" CRT televisions in the room, most channels were fuzzy or tinted grey colour. - Panaramic restaurant tried to scam us, we recieved a menu for the buffet outlining the items and cost included. So we booked, once the bill came they decided to increase the price an additional $25.00 per person. Manager claimed we were paying for coat check/parking (as guests of the hotel this was already included), then told us that was service charges and tax (with additional service chargers and tax already at the bottom of the bill). Very disrespectful and rude! Overall this hotel ruined what was going to be a relaxing vacation for me and my husband. I recommend taking your money and going elsewhere. I guarantee you will recieve better service from another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, front desk checkin was sketchey.”
Reviews.Author: Hammondstravel
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel, great location, it is in need of a renovation. Front Desk checkin was slow should have pulled the 1 minute check in or free for Delta Privlege members as the only had one person working on check in. I arrived on a wednesday nite.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive for what is offering”
Reviews.Author: Bogdan T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated downtown, at walking distance from old city and convention center. It is a four star hotel, but the furnishings are old. The view of the city is great especially from the top levels. The staff, I can't say that were rude, bud they weren't friendly either. I liked the direct connection with the Montreal's underground network straight from the hotels lobby. The breakfast was about average, but I have to mention that the coffe served in the morning was the worst I have drank in my life.The rooms were very clean, and there was a coffe maker in the room, with coffes deffinetly better then the ones from the breakfast As a conclusion, i find this hotel quite expensive for what it's offering.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: boisverf
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located on the south part of downtown. Everything you need is within 20 minutes walk which offset the need for a car. If you go to a hockey game, make this your hotel, 10 minutes walk from the Centre Bell. Hotel is dated but still very nice and clean, renovations have started and should be done by next year. Staff is very helpful and always happy to serve you, which goes a long way. What you should expect on the negative side, as always, Delta hotels haven't changed their views in the last 15 years so Internet access is 10$ a day for wired and.. they still charge for local calls, which is totally ridiculous these days. Other thing to expect, 23$ a day charge for parking, which is standard for downtown locations but the catch is... this is one of the worst underground parking I have ever seen. I was staying at the hotel with a group and I was the designated driver of a minivan being originally from Montreal. This parking is a total maze, no straight lines, parking in all directions, small parking spots, to many columns and very very small maneuvering place. I drive a minivan at home so I am very used to the size, and even with that I almost hit something about 6 times in three days. Even the below average 6 feet clearance is not entirely exact as I almost hit a ventilation duct with the roof of a Chrysler minivan.... And on top of that, to exit the parking, you have to enter another parking... So my suggestion is that you do not take a car if you go to that hotel and if you do, park somewhere else. Plenty other parking across the street and around with less trouble. Might not be underground to the same building but it could save you trouble with the rental company or a scratch and bump on your car.

Reviews.Title: “bland and uninspiring”
Reviews.Author: jetssc
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel in need of a total re-look. Everything looks aged - even if well maintained. The service is rather uninspiring, and one leaves the place instantly forgetting about it. There is nothing terribly wrong about it (except maybe the bathrooms), but this is not a hotel where you feel like coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend for wife's birthday”
Reviews.Author: Andre C
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to write a quick review of our weekend stay at the Delta Centre ville in Downtown Montreal for my wifes birthday this past weekend. I am a frequent user of Delta hotels, and for this I am fortunate to have the gold privilege status, which is very easy to obtain by the way, plus its free. We were greated in a very efficient and friendly manner, and everything was set up for us from the get go. We were upgraded to a very nice suite overlooking the city, and the view at night was amazing. I had contacted the hotel with my plans for the weekend, and I was pleasantly surprised to see that everything I had asked for was already taken care of and reserved for us by hotel administration. I insisted on meeting the operations director Mr. D'Alesio whom with I had emailed earlier in the week to advise him at how surprised I was, and how efficient they were. We had massages booked, manicure booked, restaurant reservation, and even brunch with family and friends. Everything went without a hitch, and hotel and restaurant staff were super accommodating to every request. The cherry on the sundae came when I requested to retain the room a bit longer to accommodate the 15 members of the family coming in for my wifes birthday brunch. They offered to let us stay until 18h00 if we needed which was perfect, and even sent a really nice chocolate arrangement with cookies to her attention without us even asking for it. I could go on. We had supper and brunch in the tour de Ville restaurant, and the food was simply amazing. The selection was really varied and everyone could find something he or she would enjoy. We were walking distance to all the shopping and steps from China town and old Montreal. All this to say the attention to detail was outstanding, all the staff at the reception desk were amazing, and even call you by your name when you contact the reception desk. All in all a great weekend, and many thanks to all for making this weekend a weekend to remember for us and family. I will be back to Delta Centre ville and to boot, they are going to be renovating the hotel, so all can look forward to updated rooms in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs to be renovated...”
Reviews.Author: BrunoHerd
Reviews.Content: Location is exceptional (close to all the other major hotel chains in downtown montreal) Rooms are spacious but no wireless internet in the rooms (only cable internet) Very small and expensive parking. If you dont park in their parking (because its full) it gets difficult to find your way to the hotel + you have go through a building site (and no elevator) Breakfast has good variety but the quality of the food is debatable

Reviews.Title: “Three-and-a-half stars ... perhaps the 2012 renovations boost it to 4”
Reviews.Author: DonInConnecticut
Reviews.Content: High-rise hotel in a fantastically convenient location. The good: -- The front-desk staff and bell staff were all exceptional: Cheerful, eager to go 'above and beyond' to benefit the guest. -- Clean and elegant facility; this Delta is spotless in the public spaces and the rooms. Pleasantly quiet, peaceful and spacious lobby, and a very-upscale-looking lobby-level restaurant. Know up front: -- The standard rooms are small. Make that "really small." Spacious bathroom, and tight but workable storage space. -- I'll agree with other reviewers that the existing furnishing are slightly dated, but we didn't find much that was severely old. Some of the wooden furniture had sustained a lot of chips and dings, though. -- An OK pool, a decent gym, an excellent dry sauna. The men's shower area needs some work, though, and the hotel would benefit hugely by the investment in a hot tub/whirlpool. Montreal is the sort of northern city where on most months, visitors will appreciate a hot tub. This omission is a problem for a hotel with aspirations to 4-star level. -- Parking is expensive, but that's the case at any upscale hotel downtown or in Old Towne.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but rooms need an update”
Reviews.Author: k0ke
Reviews.Content: Delta Centre-Ville is around the corner from the Via Rail Station. You can access the underground Metro network and associated shopping malls from this hotel, although the entrance is hard to find, you have to walk through the restaurant to get to it. You can walk easily to Old Montreal, Rue St Catherine (the main shopping street) and even Mont Royal is not that far away. The hotel itself is massive and the lobby and restaurant are quite new however we had a standard room which was quite dated and in need of refurbishment. The furniture was fairly old and the light bulbs surrounding the bathroom mirror made it seem very '70s. It also had two double beds which were quite small so if you are a couple, get a room with a queen or king bed instead. The room was large however and clean of course, and had nice floor to ceiling windows at one end. The downstairs restaurant is exceptional, lovely food and service. The lifts, although there are a lot of them, are quite slow. There is a small but adequate gym, quite a few cardio machines with TVs on them.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, efficient and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: GypsyKingBrussels
Reviews.Content: Spacious and clean rooms, efficient service, good breakfast, free internet PC's available in the big hotel lobby. Nice plus during winter: the hotel is conneted to the underground tunnels that allow you to cross large parts of the city without getting your feet wet (walk through the restaurant and you'll find the entry to the tunnels - not easy to find but you can ask directions at the reception).

Reviews.Title: “Two words. No WiFi”
Reviews.Author: pipelineguy
Reviews.Content: If you travel with an iPad like I do, Internet with a cable doesn't cut it. This is the first business hotel that I have stayed in a long while that didn't have wireless in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good location,tired room,so-so service”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: I had stayed last May at a very good rate and decided to stay again on the Fall Sweet Deal Promotion where one gets the second night at half-price. The attraction this time around was the Signature room and access to their rooftop lounge where a buffet style continental breakfast is served and which is included in the price of the room. The room, which was ordinary, was on the 17th floor and showed it's age both in infrastructure (one had to jiggle the door to lock it) and furnishings such as the the very limpid and tired drapes that did nothing to block out the light as dawn broke. On the plus side, the bed was comfortable with nice linens, the bathroom spotless with great water pressure in the shower. There was a turn down service with chocolates and and a bottle of water,which was a nice touch. I hear that the hotel will be undergoing a reno and I hope it will extend to this floor as well. The rooftop lounge that one accesses with one's room key is lovely with panoramic views of the city. Breakfast was excellent and truly continental with breads,cereals,pastries,eggs (hard-boiled) ,ham,cheese and yogurt...etc. In addition between 5pm and 7pm hot and cold hors d'oeuvres are served and an honour bar is maintained. The lady attendant who hosted it was discreet and welcoming. It was only when I looked at my bill that was slipped under my door the morning I checked out and saw the 50% had been deducted for the 2nd night, that I realized that other items that were promised with this promotion (discount coupons,some sort of free gift...etc) were not give me upon check-in which as I now recall was quite perfunctory. Since I don't know what I missed, I'm fine about it, however the front desk staff should pay attention to what promotions their clientele are booked on though I too could have mentioned it had I remembered. I would stay there again, but only on a similar good promotional rate as you will find much better elsewhere for the same regular rates they normally charge.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality, good location”
Reviews.Author: xSNAPx
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located just a couple blocks away from Montreal's downtown strip. Within walking distance from a lot of attractions...easily within taxi cab distance from anything. The hotel has a good feel and when not totally packed, the rooms are great. I had a room at my last visit that had very poor water pressure, but that would be my only complaint. The beds and pillows are great, the internet connection is good. Channels on TV have a good variety of English and French...however they are old TV's and an update is needed. I've stayed at this location more than 5 times and for the most part, it has been good.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious, comfortable bedroom but tired furniture. Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: BigJohnShropshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed our short two night stay in Delta Centre-Ville at the end of September. The hotel was conveniently located close to shops, eateries and the city centre. Staff were courteous, efficient and friendly, our room was spacious and the two huge beds were firm but comfortable, with good pillows and covers. The en-suite was functional and everything worked, including the large TV.My sole complaints were that we couldn't open any windows and had to rely on the air conditioning, and that the room furniture was scuffed and bare at its edges in places. I used the exercise room, swimming pool and sauna: all were small but empty of guests and everything was clean & functional. I tried visiting the revolving restaurant at the top of the hotel but was disappointed to find it locked and closed - with no real explanation other than it opened at the week-end. All in all we enjoyed our stay here and would happily return to this friendly hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice short trip”
Reviews.Author: Diane5563
Reviews.Content: Stayed there end of October with my son. Check In was quick and easy as our flight came in very late. We were put on the tenth floor overlooking the city. room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. It was quiet and warm. Tv and cabinet dated but worked well enough. Rooms were large. Bathroom large And clean. Good shower heads with strong water. We received Internet free of charge. However laptops must be wired in the rooms. iPad and cellphones only get wifi in the lobby for now. We had breakfast in their restaurant and it was very good. Excellent coffee. Reasonably priced. Good service. Nice bar/lounge area Overall. A pleasant stay and I would award the 3-3 1/2 stars. Once they remodeled I'm sure it will be a 4 star. Close to many Choice restaurants and activities. If not a quick taxi will get you there for 6-8$

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great quality”
Reviews.Author: Djgoldma
Reviews.Content: If you are looking to be downtown, great hotel, right near convention center. Clean, quiet, with tons of dining options in and around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value....Ideally Located”
Reviews.Author: Cyberjoker
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Delta Centre-Ville in the past 6 months. We were pleased with the value we received during our stay, getting a good deal on a Signature Club room that includes access to the roof top lounge, hors d'oeuvres in the evening, and a simple breakfast in the morning. Nice reception area with bilingual friendly staff and check in/out was fairly quick despite being busy. The room itself is very dated, almost like being in a time warp to the 80's with wallpaper, CRT televisions,old carpeting although they did have a clock radio with iPod docking to charge up and play your music. However, the King bed was very comfortable and the linen was clean. They use duvets here and the duvet cover seems get replaced all the time, unlike the nasty bed spreads you see in some places. The hotel is planning a huge renovation in the Spring of 2012, so the rooms should be more attractive after the reno. A huge plus with this hotel is their location, ideally situated on the Northwest corner of Old Montreal, a block or two from the Bell Centre, near the Metro, shopping, etc. I recommend that if you are driving, you park your vehicle in the underground garage ($23 per 24 hrs) as you can get pretty much anywhere via the Metro or by feet. Also, I suggest that you contact Delta directly to book your room as I believe their price is negotiable based on the amount of rooms booked. Bring along a bottle of wine to enjoy late at night on their rooftop with a fantastic view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend and a good deal”
Reviews.Author: alsupremo
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is walking distance to St Catherines Street, shopping, restaurants, Metro, train station etc and not too far from the Old Montreal on foot or $8 cab fare.Easy to get to by car. We got a good deal with priceline for $87 a night for 2 nights this weekend. Rooms are clean, bed was great and staff friendly. Parking was $23 a day with in and out priviledges. Rooms were a little tired, furniture chipped, large TV but no real issue. Heating and rooms were very quiet. Only complaint was bathroom only had one hook and no shelves so hanging towels, clothes, toiletry items etc was difficult. Also the closet door opened on to the bathroom door which was a little narrow. Found a great restaurant nearby, Gabbys. Best meal ever.

Reviews.Title: “There must be better than this to be had in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Jaguar63
Reviews.Content: I chose the Delta Centre-Ville randomly from the list of Conference Centre hotels provided - my first poor decision. The rooms are dated, the sanitary ware in mine being damaged with a large crack in the hand basin. While the bed was comfortable and the bedlinen fine, the room was dismal by comparison with most business class conference hotels with which I have much cause to be familiar. It was dark, the carpet old and dour, the decor dull and dreary. Surprised, on checking in to make these observations I looked at Trip Advisor's reviews and found that these comments had been widely observed by others also. I was amused to see the repeated assurances of the Manager that all would be rectified - well, please allow me to assure you that none has been. His corporate bleating is dull and meaningless as he and his firm continue to rip off unsuspecting customers by charghing maximum rates for a grossly inferior produce. Do take into account that the hotel restaurant must be among the worst I have ever experienced, with a very poor menu and no semblance of fine dining to be seen. In a 28 floor hotel with hundreds if not thousands of bedrooms, the exercise room comprises 3 treadmills and a few cycle machines. A truly dismal little place with none of the facilities which the travelling businessman might reasonably expect from a hotel charging these rates. Each morning around 6 a.m. there was a queue of several disappointed guests who could not use the "facilities" because they were so inadequate. Doubtless the general manager will have some reassuring words to offer on finding these scathing remarks - don't believe them. His previous assurances have been meaningless and, rather than delivering a decent experience for his customers, he appears more interested in seeking to project some future aspiration into the psyche of those unwisely considering staying at this vastly over-rated, deeply disappointing example of corporate greed gone mad. The most dismal hotel experience of a 30 year business career. I felt ashamed to have been duped by this guy and his lousy corporation.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: Missy156
Reviews.Content: Not the best place to stay in Montreal (Quality/price wise). Our room was in need of a face lift; old furniture; old TV; basically a disapointment; after crossing the beautiful entrance- with valet etc... I don't know if some of the rooms have been upgraded; but we certainly were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I GOT BED BITES!!”
Reviews.Author: BB143
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Delta Centre-Ville over the Larbor Day long weekend. I have to say that the location is pretty good - was able to walk to Old Montreal. The 2 things I have to complain about are: 1) went back to the hotel late one night (just after 4am) and there was someone cleaning the hotel lobby floor. As we walked passed to go to the elevators, the guy cleaning, gave us the dirtiest look and kept saying "S---" & "F---". Ummm ... excuse me, but we are hotel guests that need to get to the elevator. There is no need to swear at us because we happened to walk over your newly mopped floors. This is just unacceptable 2) this is the reason I'm writing this review. I GOT BED BITES!! I woke up with 14 itchy red spots on my right arm, where I touched the hotel bedspread (the yellow, rough fleecy blanket). See pic attached

Reviews.Title: “Good choice in Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Ottavian
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for four nights on a conference. It is a good business hotel with very good service in all areas: front desk, conference facilities, door people. The room was spacial, offered nice business desk. Internet did work. The view from the 11th floor room was not great, but one does not have to spend time looking through the windows all the time. A few nice eating establishments can be found at walking distance from the hotel. The railway station with a small shopping area is not far away, however a bit uphill. Parking: It is a bit difficult to find it, if you travel by car from West. You have to go around the hotel and then find the entrance to the parking on the other side of the hotel than the reception is. Actually it is the best to go through a small one-way alley behind the hotel. The reception at the front of the hotel is located also on the one-way alley leading in the opposite direction than the parking one. The parking inside is really tight. I had a full size car and parking it was a bit challenging, because only tricky spots were left free when I arrived. In summary, I recommend this hotel as a good stay when on a business trip to lovely Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, awesome beds, a bit dated but adequate”
Reviews.Author: LakeviewGuy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Oasis Montreal Half-Marathon, so we wanted something close to transit to get to the starting line as well as a comfortable place to sleep afterwards. The hotel had a dated '80s look in the lobby as well as our room. The TV cabinet was clunky and had a few cracks in it. However, our room was always clean, the beds super comfortable, and the location was very convenient. The fitness center was actually pretty good for a hotel, and the pool looked great but we didn't have a chance to use it. I got a great rate as the hotel was associated with the marathon, so that was huge plus! I would stay here again for the location and value, but not necessarily for a cool hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: abcdef46756
Reviews.Content: Old, stinks of smoke, seriously outdated. There is no more to say. If you want to stay at Deltaville make sure you come after renovations which start spring 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Hubert G
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at the Delta Centre-Ville and must say I am having a wonderful time. The front desk and housekeeping staff have been very friendly and the restaurant breakfast buffet was delicious. Our room was clean and had a great view. Old Montreal is just steps away and we have been walking everywhere. I would not hesitate to recommend this Delta to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN AT DELTA”
Reviews.Author: andrea g
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is very nice: 15 minutes away on foot from shipping area, 10 minutes away on foot from old Montreal. Hotel lobby is very nice and luxury. We found the reception service too slow (only 1 empoyee). We had a room at 19th floor. The room was very very very poor. the room looks very old, Moisture stains on the roof, no wi-fi in the room, internet connection at 10$ per day. the bathroom was older that the room. the TUB was loosing peace of painting, the wallpaper was open in some wall points, no air fan in the bathroom. No flat TV but a very old tv, quality very poor. Breakfast is excellent but expensive. 2 nights were around 600$. Be aware of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little old”
Reviews.Author: e_wire
Reviews.Content: This hotel would benefit from renovations. Rooms are show their age. Overall ok, but most certainly not a 4 stars. I'd rate this a 3 star hotel. Good thing I got a killer deal via Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Staff & Beautiful Room!”
Reviews.Author: Chad D
Reviews.Content: I travelled to the Delta Centre-Ville this weekend and absolutely enjoyed EVERY minute of my stay. The purpose of the trip was to relax with a few friends in a suite for the weekend and it couldn't have been better. Upon check-in, I was surprised to see that my reservation was made for one night instead of two. Tara, the front desk agent, let me know with a smile that this would not be a problem and she would be more than happy to make the change for me. Crisis averted! Aside from this, the checkin couldnt have gone smoother. (thank you!) The room was perfect! A two floor suite on the 28th floor with the ability to entertain people in the living room without having the bedroom invaded was a great feature! The view of the Old Port was spectacular at night! After a superb night out with friends, the front desk staff made us feel right at home and offered us help at any question. Cynthia and Ester could not have been more helpful in our quests later in the evening. Although I am sure anyone else would have gotten annoyed, these two workers smiled and laughed the whole time. Such a pleasure! Francois, the Security Guard also helped make us feel like we were more than welcome at the hotel with his friendliness. The four people mentioned in this post helped create such an amazing trip to Montreal that I will definitely return to this hotel again! Their passion for work and commitment to service is displayed through their smiles and interactions. Thank you for such a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nice beds, terrible service, disappointing food.”
Reviews.Author: lostintheworld
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Centre-ville last weekend for a convention, I had been there a couple of years before and was hoping for a better experience, it was a little worse. The restaurant/bar downstairs had astoundingly bad service. It was not busy that night, there were a few others in our section and everyone noticed the waitress taking a very long time to bring menus and take orders. She was working at the computer kiosk, back to the room for a good amount of time, then over to the front desk, back to the kiosk etc. We waited about twenty-five minutes for menus. The food selection was not that good, with not a lot of options for those looking for something healthy/vegetarian. I ordered Thai spring rolls and it was not like any Thai spring roll I've ever had, the wrap was not a crispy rice but made from flour. Not a lot of protein other than a few snap peas. Not good. And pricey. From what I saw of other people's meals over the weekend, the food was heavy, cafeteria-ish and not very appetizing. The in-room service menu was not much better (Suckling Pig "a l'orange" was one option, seriously?) and closed at 11pm so if you have jet lag and need a little something after hours, you're out of luck. Back to that first night, some friends came in as we were trying to find the waitress to pay the bill (no check in for water/drinks from her), and they reported the next day having just as many issues with service and food (one has bad allergies). That waitress pretty much disappeared, leaving a couple of American tourists grabbing pitchers and serving water to the other customers. The rooms were clean and the beds firm and comfortable, but the building is old and the windows don't open leaving you at the mercy of the air conditioning/heating which after a couple of days left me feeling crazy claustrophobic. Rue St. Catherines is pretty close... after a torturous climb uphill. There aren't a lot of food options in the area for several blocks around so it was quite depressing whenever it came time to eat after a long day at the Bonaventure where the food court options are just as bleak. Overall, the place is just not very inviting and I really hope I don't have to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel but a little bit unpersonal”
Reviews.Author: jcbolay
Reviews.Content: The Delta Centre-Ville Hotel in Montreal is a tower of 30 flloors and nice large rooms but a little bit old styled arranged. Nothing special, no charm but normally functional, and free access to internet through cable. The breakfast is as the room, functional but nothing very appealing. The hotel is located around 1000 meters out of Sainte Catherine, ouf of the vibrant shopping center and one mile from the old part of Montreal, but with a metro station just under the hotel, areal +. Have a look on the price, this could be the decisive factor to decide

Reviews.Title: “Poor nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: hearts78
Reviews.Content: The hotel is within walking distance of main line station. It is very big and impersonal. Our 7th floor room was at times very noisy-traffic from below. There seemed to be a lot of airline staff staying and at times there was a feeling of being pushed out of the way. In our stay in Canada this was the one place where we found someone who was rude and abrupt-porter at front of hotel when we asked for directions. The room was clean but worn, no wardrobe, not even a hanger. There is a small shop in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “An OK hotel”
Reviews.Author: 10izboy
Reviews.Content: I needed a room in Montreal at last minute, my usual choices were either booked or prohibitively expensive. I used Priceline and ended up here. the hotel is reasonably centrally located; although in all likelihood you will need to walk up hill to wherever you go. The check in staff were very courteous and helpful. I used valet parking and tipped the bellman to keep the car in front for me as I was going out for dinner. 30 minutes later when I came down, my car was no where to be seen. The rooms are decent size, the toiletries nice, however the furnishings were defintely showing their age. Their were rips in the carpet, and the taps in the sink felt like they would break at any time. I ended up paying $110 for the night plus tax, which is about what the room was worth.

Reviews.Title: “first class stay all the way”
Reviews.Author: lucilleOntarioCanada
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at Delta Hotels across the country. Delta Centre-ville was a great experience. Quick check in. Help with maps and tourist stuff. Clean and large hotel room. Nice gift shop. Great location to downtown core and Old Montreal. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for walking the city, dated decor in rooms”
Reviews.Author: eng2mksd
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference that was held at the Palais de Congres and it was a short walk from the hotel. Checking in (the same weekend as the Grand Prix) we had a few issues. My coworker was unable to get in her room until a few hours past check in time and was never given a straight answer when it would be available. My room was very dated with old comforters, an old television, and the bathroom sink and tub were aged. The wall and ceiling were dirty from the air vent (see photos). The location was good for walking most of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Two Nights”
Reviews.Author: Evelin W
Reviews.Content: We had not been back to Montreal in years. Stayed at this hotel for 2 nights Sept. 15th and 16th. Got a decent rate on Priceline and since I always stay at the Delta Chelsea in Toronto was pleased with what I got. The hotel is in a excellent location so we were able to walk everywhere. Never ate there, prices seemed high. Parking is confusing and expensive at $23.00 a night. There is parking across the street for less but not as convenient. I would definitely stay there again. Room was clean, good beds and the service excellent. I especially want to thank Marlin who checked me in. What a great employee, so helpful and just a genuinely nice man. Thank you! Try to visit the Atwater Market, great food and reasonable. Just a few minutes drive from the hotel. Good English Pup Fish and Chips around corner on McGill.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well located”
Reviews.Author: Pegnick
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay which was helped by an excellent on-line price. This is a quality hotel with sizable rooms, an attractive lobby with internet in the lobby, and well located if you want to visit and dine in the old city. Health spa is small but beautiful with a nice little pool. The hotel is a business quality hotel (not like a b and b) with expensive amenities. Nice dining room and breakfast area. No wifi in the rooms but the lobby had multiple computers that were conveniently located. We spent a long weekend biking on the bike trails and visiting the old city. On-line deals were attractive about 6 weeks before we stayed. Price was more than double for people booking on that weekend. A good price always shades a review. Parking is extra, around $20/day. I liked its proximity to the subway and St. Paul St.

Reviews.Title: “Great host hotel for Montreal bike race, OK hotel for anything else”
Reviews.Author: no_hills
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the host hotel for the Montreal Grand Prix Cycliste 2011 - but that enjoyment was primarily based upon being at the centre of all of the cycling action. It was a great chance to see our cycling heroes up close. The hotel itself is well located between old Montreal and the downtown shopping area, close to the Metro. Our room, like the rest of the hotel, was clean and comfortable but had dated decor. The bathroom really needs work - there was a hole in the wall, the tub would not drain unless you jammed something under the plug, and the bathtub surface had peeled off at several places. The pool area was very clean, and there was always a staff member present, which I haven't seen at many hotels. Restaurant service was very friendly, and the food was fine, but the other staff seemed nowhere in existence. We were offered no help with luggage, the driveway was blocked by cars for over 15 minutes when we were trying to leave, and no one at the front desk was able to provide decent suggestions for dining with children. Although other reviewers have suggested children get welcome packages, there was no offer of anything to our children. I would stay here again if the bike race makes this their host hotel, or if there was an amazing deal, but for anything else I would choose one of the interesting, more modern properties throughout Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “A lttile dated but the best beds!”
Reviews.Author: AuntieBebPenndel_PA
Reviews.Content: Room was large and had a nice view of the city. Furniture was a little worn and the bathroom was dated. Easy walk to the Old Town Montreal and the Piers. Two restaurants inside the hotel. The revolving roof top restaurant serves a Friday night buffet. Beautiful presentation. Hotel gave us coupons for $10 off each persons dinner. No price on the menu displayed ourside the retaurant. Needless to say we were a little shocked when the bill arrived at $153.00 for 2 people with no alcohol. And that was agter the discount. Food was good, but too expensive for a buffet. Downstairs restaurant was easier on the prices but still high in our opinion. Buffett breakfast was $20.00 each or you can order off the menu. Dinner there averaged $70.00 a night with no alcohol. We did take the 6 hour Grayline Tour of the city, which was conveniently avaiable to book via direct connection in the lobby. This gave us a full tour of major city highlights. We would stay there again for convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place from which to do Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Chad1946
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, location, complementary breakfast and hors d'oeuvres

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, close to shopping”
Reviews.Author: RENERICA
Reviews.Content: Great stay. Hotel staff very accommodating. Offered welcome package to our young child at check in. Close to everything, will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back but needs updating within the year...”
Reviews.Author: Carefree2008
Reviews.Content: Slight Negative This hotel is at the bottom of University Avenue, a short walk up a fairly steep hill to downtown Montreal. One can take a city bus, a nearby subway, or a taxi to avoid the hill. Many Positives If walking is not an issue for you, there are big plusses about the location. These include location: near Hwy 2/20 exit/entrance, which leads to the West Island and links with other Montreal highways, close to bridges to the South Shore and within a short drive to Mount Royal. A casual walk to Old Montreal, the Bell Centre home of the Montreal Canadians, Central Train Station the base for Via Rail, China Town and an uphill walk to the shopping area and night life of St Catherine Street in downtown Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Average room, indifferent staff”
Reviews.Author: tjbimson
Reviews.Content: Our room was in need of updating; the bathtub drain was broken and it would have been impossible to take a bath. The sink was cracked and the wallpaper peeling. TV was an old CRT. The staff was indifferent at best. The chasseur at the front desk would not allow us to park at the entrance for the 10 minutes it would have taken to check in and drop off our bags (parking is some distance away). When I took my kids swimming, the pool attendant wouldn't give us any towels; my 5 year old boy was dripping and very cold on the way back to our room. The hotel was extremely busy, but that's no excuse for rude and indifferent service. I don't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience will be back for another stay!”
Reviews.Author: acg227
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a indoor pool, fitness centre, comfortable beds and the staff at the Delta Centre -ville are awesome. From the concierge to housekeeping they make your stay wonderful! I have stayed at the Four Seasons and Sutton Place, this was by far the most enjoyable and you can't go wrong with the location. Visiting Montreal, stay at the Delta Centre-ville!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: teeceeTO
Reviews.Content: This hotel has definitely seen better days. It is located right on the edge of business district in Montreal and about 5 mins. away from Old Montreal. Easy access to great restaurants, subway, train station, etc. Rooms vary in experience as they have updated some, but not all. Sometimes you get a great view of city depending on where your room is located. But overall, a little shabby-- washroom has peeling paint, rusty patches in area. Carpet is old. Musty smells. Room service is horrible. Had a very expensive but inedible omelette.

Reviews.Title: “Just average”
Reviews.Author: MeginToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Delta Centre-Ville for a week while attending a conference in Montreal. The hotel was slightly dated and all the furniture in the room looked a little rough around the edges. To their credit, the hotel is planning a major renovation in the fall (hopefully they'll get rid of the old carpet). The bed was very comfortable and we slept well as a result. However, I developed a rash all over my body within two days of arriving; I'm quite certain this was due to the chemicals used in the cleaning solutions and / or laundry detergent. The air quality in our room wasn't great and we were not able to open the windows. My husband has a dust allergy and by the end of the trip he was very congested. The cleaning staff were friendly, but the front desk staff were very cold. We did appreciate the Globe and Mail that was delivered to our door every morning. The location is convenient. It's a quick walk to the metro and several excellent restaurants. The view was nice enough. When we made the reservation we requested a room on an upper floor. They didn't give us one and when we asked again on arrival they simply said "no". Not a big deal. I would like to see the hotel make an effort to be more sustainable. The air conditioning was blasting at all times, strong chemicals were cleary used by the cleaning staff and no recycling bins were provided in the rooms. Perhaps this can be addressed during the renovations. Overall the hotel is perfectly fine for a business trip. However, we wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Gets the job done”
Reviews.Author: bgdn
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for a weekend in August and we both thought it was ok. As some people are saying, the hotel is quite out-dated and is in need of some renovations (everything looks like it belongs in the 70's/80s'), however our room was clean and everything worked just fine. Location wise it is a few steps from a subway station and a short walk from Old Montreal/Notre-Dame. There is also parking directly across the street from the hotel for around 10 bucks per day, should you need it. Should be noted that the hotel rates can be pricey (and not worth it all if you ask me) however if you check around, you should be able to find a really good deal. Average price when we looked was upwards of 160 per night... but we ended up finding it for under 100, which I think is a good price for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: swnber
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights here for a family vacation; our first family trip to Montreal. Pros: The hotel was very clean and the staff very friendly Access to the subway through the hotel was very convenient. It's within walking distance to St. Catherines Street, McGill, Bell Center, old Montreal, China Town, loads of restaurants,etc. Cons: internet access in the room didn't work, night maintenance staff couldn't fix it nor the telephone support person. Kind of important to the teenagers with us and was included with the room rate. Also, probably the smallest tv I've seen in a long time, but not too important as I just like to catch the news before bed. We're in Montreal after all we didn't come to watch tv! We were havig such a great time, we wanted to stay another night but the hotel was completely booked (in our price bracket anyway) but the staff were able to offer us the penthouse suite for a super discounted rate (I know, I know, they want to have every room full ;o) ) so it was a grand finish to our Montreal vacation. Thanks Delta staff! You were all super polite and helpful. We certainly recommend this hotel and enjoyed our stay,

Reviews.Title: “Needs a remodel, staff are friendly”
Reviews.Author: Pinki77
Reviews.Content: This hotel seriously needs a remodel for the amount of money they are charging. It feels like the last time this place got a facelift was 1989. Food in the hotel is fine, but not really great. The only thing that makes this hotel tolerable is the fact that it is connected to an underground food court and the Metro. There is a rundown on the specifics: -first room they out me in reeked of smoke, although it was a "no smoking room" - furniture is so used, that the finishes are wearing off - stains on the carpet - grout missing between the tub and the tile - fitted sheet didn't really fit the bed, so it kept coming off - no wifi in rooms, have to use a short Ethernet cable at the uncomfortable desk - sheer curtains somehow had stains - Internet access will cost 9.99 a day -the restaurant is where bad 80's music comes to die

Reviews.Title: “Right in the center, and very nice - stayed 10 days”
Reviews.Author: Neuch_11
Reviews.Content: Staff : ok Room : clean and new, with a great view over MontrÃ©al (28th floor) But : no fridge, no safe, no wifi We stayed for 10 days and we liked it.
