Inside swimming pool : nice Breakfast : the food was nice, the staff... not so nice Do not forget to remind staff at check-in that breakfast is included or they will "forget" to give you vouchers. Porters Valet parking (paying, but warn them well in advance, or you're in for a long wait).

Reviews.Title: “Entirely Average. Tired and desperately in need of some TLC!”
Reviews.Author: UKflightattendant
Reviews.Content: The location of the Delta Centre-Ville is very convenient; it offers good access to the commercial areas of MontrÃ©al, along with the University and it is a pleasant, accessible walk to the Old Town and tourist 'hotspots' of the city. The hotel itself, however, is certainly in need of some TLC and is long overdue the planned 'upgrade' that is due to take place this Autumn/Winter (2011-12), particularly with regard to the accommodations. Even though I stayed at the Centre-Ville in the middle of August, and even though the room did indeed feature floor-to-ceiling windows, I couldn't help feeling that the room was very 'dark'. The general colour-scheme is very 'Autumnal' - a palette of browns, beiges, with the odd 'splash' of leaf-green which was undoubtedly intended to lift things a little but is so muted it doesn't quite achieve the desired affect! Furniture in the room is very traditional, well-worn dark mahogany-effect; much of it is chipped and clearly very dated in design, (bedside nightstands, work desk, TV cabinet etc.) There is some interesting (!) wood-panelling going on, which certainly belies the age of it all! There have clearly been some (relatively) recent attempts at refreshing the dÃ©cor - the lamps are quite modern and are very much of the ilk you'd find in a Marriott or Sheraton, and the black-and-white photography on the walls is quite attractive - but these improvements are easily achieved and can only 'cover the cracks' - not literally, I hope/assume! - for so long before major rennovations are required! It has been mentioned before, but the quality of the bedding in the room really is woefully poor. As I say, even though I was in Montreal during sunny, balmy August, I felt quite chilly in bed. After removing the top sheet, I expected to find a blanket underneath, so thin was the bedding - it was actually some kind of duvet/quilt/comforter but there was literally no filling to be found inside - so basically you sleep under four sheets, and that is it. How it would have felt in the middle of a freezing Canadian Winter, I shudder to think! This kind of thing really is unacceptable - it's something that can easily be changed without closing off rooms/floors etc. Things weren't made any easier by the antiquated A/C control unit; the guide to using same in the hotel information book made it sound so easy - however, mine was clearly on its last legs, with a cover taped back on and the labelling of the control options worn off after years of use, making it impossible to adjust room temperature. The bathroom was a decent size, and there was plenty of space round the sink unit for all my toiletries. The shower looked suspiciously old but functioned well. However - and it has been mentioned by other reviewers - the environmental policy asking guests to hang up towels they are happy to reuse is difficult to achieve if there aren't actually any towel racks/rails in the bathroom! My sink/basin featured two large cracks, which had probably been there some time - nomatter how much scrubbing/cleaning goes on, the dirt will accumulate and make them very visible! I cannot comment on the dining facilities of the hotel, since I opted to eat out and bought some snacks in for lunch. Do note that there aren't any fridges or minibars in the rooms, but ice machines are supposedly located on even-numbered floors. Some other reviewers have noted that they couldn't find instructions on how to use the A/C, or locations of the ice machines etc - perfectly understandable, since the 'hotel book' which most establishments display prominently so that guests can familiarise themselves with the services etc. on offer, was hidden away in the work-desk drawer! Overall, I do think this hotel - like so many others of its type - has to a certain extent 'rested on its laurels' and benefited from a constant stream of guests over the years - conference guests, tourists, airline crews, etc. It's a busy place, which means rennovations are hard to achieve, (and let's face it - if you can sell the rooms without making any rennovations, why bother?!), but the upcoming improvements will be most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating...”
Reviews.Author: Richard P
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in early August. We got the room at a reduced rate, so it was a good deal for Montreal. The room has seen better days. The desk was water stained and the bathroom faucets needed an upgrade. We were provided with an ice bucket, but no written instructions to find the pop or ice machines. We were encouraged to reuse our towels but not given a towel bar to hang them on. There were also no instructions (French or English) about how to control the air conditioning. On the plus side... The pool, while small, did come with a lifeguard... The revolving restaurant, although expensive, offered a breath-taking view of the city... Next time, however, I'd probably opt to pay $20 more and stay somewhere else...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: KasparZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for the Montreal Pride. This was a great experience. My room was located very high (on the 28th floor) with a fabulous view to Montreal. Staff was very helpful and nice, both answering all the questions and giving information what to do and where to go. One thing I love about the stay about in Delta was the pillows - the best pillows I ever had :) One bad thing - I still don't understand why hotels charge for wifi (it is like charge for a water), internet was available for free on the ground floor, but it is too little! Thanks for the great stay! Will come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but pricey”
Reviews.Author: marknmike
Reviews.Content: Room was nice and very clean. Convenient to centre-ville. No fridge or micro. TV was old. They are renovating some rooms. Connects to Metro, but a long walk underground. $200+ per night + $23 parking +++++. Does not include breakfast ($20 pp). But all downtown hotels are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Not really what was expected”
Reviews.Author: LindsToronto
Reviews.Content: We went to Montreal for the weekend and booked through priceline. I was excited to get Delta however it didn't really turn out to be what we expected. They have no fridges or microwaves in any of the rooms and we where offered internet with our room for an additional $20. Upon checking out there was 2 charges for $20. They ended up taking it off but this was after we where told it had been for the room upgrade. I'm not sure what we where upgraded to because of the no fridge or microwave situation. The room itself was fine nothing special or fancy though! Also, it was very nice when we where waiting in line at 12pm to checkout and the girl said she was going on lunch even though there was a huge line!

Reviews.Title: “Bartender at the Chez Antoine Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Melodie777
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Montreal for the Rogers Cup and we stayed one night at the Delta. We were really impressed with the view and service, but most of all, we have to mention one employee. Her name is Marie-Claude, bartender at the Bistro Chez Antoine (restaurant near the lobby). We feel that we have to mention her excellent and top notch service. We have been served by many bartenders and waiters, waitresses before and in different cities, but we had never been served by someone like Marie-Claude. She has a passion for what she does and cares about the customers. She made our stay more enjoyable and made us feel like home. Thank you Marie-Claude! Melody

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean but is ready for an update!”
Reviews.Author: abigllama
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at other Delta properties but this was our first at this location. Awesome location just a block south from the train station. Also there's a metro entrance just around the corner so easy access via transit to all rest of the city. Never had to bother with cabs and you really don't need a car in the car in the city. We got a great deal on hotwire, based on the reviews expectations were low but we enjoyed our stay here. Check in was a breeze. The first room they gave us smelled like a dirty ashtray, despite this being smoke-free hotel. The front desk was appologetic and moved us to another room that was fine and smelled fresh. Despite the room being a bit worn, the bed was comfortable and everything was very clean. Staff were friendly and the front desk took good care of us when we needed something. We needed some additional towels one day and they showed up about a minute after we asked for them! The hotel in general has a very '80s feel to it so they're ready for an update. Fixtures in the bathroom were a bit worn but housekeeping did a great job of keeping everything clean so it really wasn't an issue. The nostalgic wood paneling in the room has scratches, rug is a bit worn but we got a great deal on our room so not a big deal. I understand renovations will start later this year and we'll be glad to return to see what they have done. Breakfast options were a bit limited. There's a rotating resturant on top and a buffet in the lobby. But not really anything if you want to just grab something quick, we actually went up to the train station for that. With all of the fantastic places to eat in Montreal, don't want to waste the time or money on an overpriced buffet in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “THREATENED at the hotel but staff did not help”
Reviews.Author: Doris L
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying at the Delta Centre-Ville hotel in Montreal (August 13, 2011) and the bad experience I had with them will make it my last. Tonight we were lining up at the reception. Another guest jumped the line and got served ahead of us. I kindly reminded that guest that other people were waiting in line and next time he should not jump the line again. He started to swear at us repeatedly and asked if we wanted to â€œpunch himâ€�. For the entire duration, that guest used swear words not less then eight times. There were two hotel staff at the front desk and one at the front entrance. NONE OF THE HOTEL STAFF DID ANYTHING TO STOP THE OTHER GUEST FROM SWEARING AT ME AND THREATENING ME. Even when I asked for security because I felt threatened, the front desk staff was reluctant to do so. When the security staff finally came, that guest was still swearing at us. I WAS APPLAUDED THAT THE SECURITY STAFF ALSO DID NOT DO ANYTHING TO STOP SUCH BEHAVIOUR. He just brushed the entire incident off when we talked to him about what happened. I am a petite girl, while the other guest is a 7-foot tall man. It is easy to understand why I would feel threatened by him. It is unacceptable that the staff at the hotel would allow such behaviour in the lobby and would not offer any help to me. When I asked what I should do if the other guest bother me during the rest of my stay, the security staff told me to call 911 and did not offer me any extra help. I am writing this to warn anyone who may be interested in staying at this hotel. THE SECURITY STAFF TOLD ME DELTA HOTELS HAVE NO POLICIES PROTECTING THEIR GUESTS AGAINST SUCH VIOLENT BEHAVIOURS. I am deeply concerned about my safety in this hotel during my stay and will not return again.

Reviews.Title: “loved it, will be back”
Reviews.Author: Lam1-glasgow
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Delta Centre-ville as part of a month long trip across Canada. The hotel is ideally situated, a few minutes easy walk from the main station and right on the edge of the Old Town - again only a few minutes walk but just far enough away to ensure not too busy or noisy. We found the staff to be extremely efficient, helpful and very friendly. When we arrived there was a large queue at reception as there was a conference being held that weekend and lots of people had arrived at the same time. However there were lots of staff on the desks, waiters circulated with free cold drinks and other members of staff introduced themselves to those of us still queuing, handing out maps of the local area and recommending places to visit - so the check-in time was not nearly as bad as we feared and due to the attentive staff, passed quickly - a very good introduction to the hotel. We had worried that our high school french (or lack of) might be a problem but everyone spoke English - and no-one laughed when we tried out our French! The hotel has a lovely pool and gym and a couple of shops - good for souvenirs or if you have forgotten an essential. The room was very good - clean, elegant and comfortable. There was a slight problem with the restaurant on the night we arrived - it was extremely busy, possibly due to the Conference, so we were seated in the bar but that was very comfortable so not a big deal - but our order took ages to arrive (we gave up on the desserts) and then we were given the wrong bill at the end. However we were given a huge apology - the manager of the restaurant did exactly the right thing, no excuses, and it did not spoil the actual meal which was very good. We did not eat in the hotel again, simply because we wanted to try some of the many good local restaurants, but passing by the restaurant on subsequent evenings, everything seemed to be very efficient so I think we were just unlucky. We hope to return to Montreal one day and will definitely stay in this hotel again. A big thankyou to all the staff for making this part of our holiday so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Very average, way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: kkla1
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with our Aeroplan points. I really feel sorry for people that pay over $200 per night from their pocket. This is very average hotel. Did I mention the $200+ per night. Our "premier" room would cost $240. The only premium thing in the room were 2 double beds (standard room has one king bed). The breakfast is extra $20. Parking extra $23. Wireless internet (free in 90% of the hotels today) is extra $10. The rooms are very outdated. The AC is very noisy, the water pressure weak. There is no minibar or fridge, no safe either. The location is very good and the stuff helpful, but those are pretty much the only good things I can say about this hotel. It is not worth more than $100 per night, including breakfast and parking. If you can get it at this price, go for it, otherwise try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: adt0312
Reviews.Content: Stayed with a colleague for a convention. The location was a bit farther away from the convention center than planned but not too long of a walk. Room was very adequate. It met our needs (we were only there to sleep and get ready for the next full day of meetings). If you are in a hurry, walk to the convention center at street level (the underground walkway requires going up and down many escalators/stairs and winding around). Take your patience with you when dining (or if you are in a hurry, let the wait staff know asap).

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: mls12345
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed five nights here and I do not recommend staying here for any length of time. Things that where supposed to be included in our room where not. When we arrived breakfast was supposed to be included only to find out it was not. It was 19.95 a person. There is not internet in the room unless you want to pay 9.95 a day. I have stayed at two star hotels where it was standard. There are no fridges in your room. If you want one they charge you for it. They charge for everything. There are not laundry facilities. I have had to wash clothes by hand the whole week even thought they advertise laundry. I have blisters all over my hands because of doing this. The room never got cleaned before three each day and by that time the kids and I where tired and just wanted to relax but had to leave the room so it could get cleaned. I will pay a little more for a room as you end up paying more in things you want and need here at this hotel. The Hilton across the street gives you breakfast, a fridge, internet and parking. They also have coin laundry.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that count....”
Reviews.Author: sportstravelerganz
Reviews.Content: Great location if you want to explore Montreal however.... Hotels advertises free wifi access which is pretty much the standard in the industry right now. There is actually free wifi but don't expect it in your room of course; what an unreasonable assumption for a guest! As long as you're happy working in the hotel lobby then go for it.. You might find yourself a little cold while you're trying to sleep. The reason being is that I think the quilts that Delta provides have been around as long as the hotel itself. These things are so worn that the stuffing in them is compacted around the edges of the quit leaving nothing (literally) in the area you would actually occupy when sleeping.As a result the "quilt" is nothing more that than two sheets touching each other. Bed was comfortable but the actual bedding made the whole arrangement useless for sleeping. I also stayed at the Delta in Waterloo in April and they had the same lousy quilts. Both Hotels also put a sheet on top on then to disguise how threadbare and ancient they are. Hotel parking is a huge issue. This Hotel has a 700 guest rooms but only 200 parking spaces and the underground parking is like navigating a mine field. Sports teams be aware that your contract will state a flat rate rate for parking ($18 per Diem) with full in/out privileges. However when the hotels insufficient parking is full (and it always is) you're expected to park in the underground of the stock exchange without making mention of the fact that there are NO in/out privileges and the rate is much higher per day. You could easily hit $50 per day in the stock exchange parking lot if you actually want to use your car. I complained and the front desk asked me if I will be using my car for the three days I was there. That was bright.... Finally, don't expect a fridge. God forbid you may want a glass of milk in your room or have some snacks there for the family. Better call room service for that. I'm done with Delta. I don't fell very "privileged" with this nonsense going on especially at more than one location. Bye bye Delta

Reviews.Title: “love the location & the service”
Reviews.Author: Donna155004
Reviews.Content: great hotel, nicely situated between Old Montreal and the fabulous shopping on Saint Catherine Street, and not too far from the even more fabulous bars & patios on Crescent Street. Hotel staff are very friendly, in either English or French, and very interested in your stay being great. We try to stay here every time we are in Montreal, and every time they exceed our expectations. From the friendly and fast valet staff at the front door to the friendly housekeeping staff on the floors, this hotel knows how to train employees to do things right.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay somewhere else..”
Reviews.Author: karenjwood
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I really disliked this hotel. We were booked for a non-smoking king sized bed room and they gave us a smoking one telling us that's what we booked. I can't be around smoke so I asked them to switch our rooms. The only rooms they had left for us were ones with a double bed. My husband and I could barely fit on the bed. We were there for the Jazz festival and we were supposed to get a bag with passes and tshirts but we didn't. Then they gave us the wrong bag when we called down. They called the room panicking about an hour later (we could have left!) and said they gave us the wrong bag and that it belonged to someone else. Anyways. So finally we got our bag. The staff weren't very friendly to us throughout this whole process. Somehow it was our fault. So we go out and enjoy some of the festival events come home and try to sleep. Ridiculously difficult considering 1. the size of the bed, and 2. the bed was impossibly lumpy and hard. The bed was old and felt like it was more than 20 years old. It was super uncomfortable. My husband and I both woke up with very sore backs. I will definitely stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Located conveniently right downtown.”
Reviews.Author: Headanac1
Reviews.Content: Great location for an excellent stay. Rooms are large and clean. Staff is friendly, knowledgeable, and fully bilingual. Old Montreal and rue Saint-Catherine are within walking distance. Via Rail and Amtrak terminal is right across the street!

Reviews.Title: “The lady working the bar was an absolute gem!”
Reviews.Author: JustinW416
Reviews.Content: A definite thumbs up, scored a great summer promo as well! An excellent hotel and great downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “spacious hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: debrap2011
Reviews.Content: For AATF French teachers convention July 5-9, I enjoyed a comfortable room and courteous service from the front desk staff. They gave detailed directions w. maps to help me take metro to visit friends and visit the Beaux Arts museum. The indoor swimming pool is small for the large number of guest but it is well maintained. Convention rooms and ballrooms are large w. good sound quality. I recommend this place for its location near the old city and for the helpful personnel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent walking location to downtown Montreal”
Reviews.Author: Hammer222222
Reviews.Content: Hotel has amazing beds, duvet and down filled pillows that provide a first class sleep. Restaurant serves excellent food for both breakfast and late night arrival. Check-in staff is courteous and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities but rooms need an uplift”
Reviews.Author: KianaArt
Reviews.Content: Good facilities - internet, printing, pool, gym etc. Linked to an underground shopping centres with cheap eating places and shops. Staff are pleasant. However, rooms need an uplift, they're kept clean by housekeeping but decor is yellowing and old, stains on the ceilings, rooms have a stale air, aircon doesn't get cool enough, showers not hot enough or strong enough, no safe in rooms etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Greenwillow
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located in a good area for walking. It's in between downtown and old Montreal which was great for sightseeing. I liked our room, was very clean, air conditioned and the bed was comfy. My main complaint would be that the rooms do not have wifi! They do have it in the lobby but in the rooms they have a cable to plug into your laptop if that is what you brought. Unfortunately we brought our ipad which meant we had to go to the Lobby every time we needed to check our emails or to find something online. Also the pool there is very small and when we did check in on it a few times there were always a lot of kids in it. Also never order a Long Island Iced tea from them, it was horrible and tasted like bitter lemon. But overall we both slept well there and liked the location even though the area lacked Montreal charm. P.S. Make sure you go onto Delta's site and sign up as a Delta Privilage member. It's free and by signing up you get free internet, local phones calls and other perks when you book with them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ADKRET
Reviews.Content: Location is great if you are a "walker." Central to Old Montreal, the underground shops, and up the hill to shopping on St. Catherine Street. Parking rate is reasonable for city parking and valid from check-in until 6 p.m. next day. Easy access from Rt 10--to access parking headinging into the city, pass in front of hotel, turn right and right on first side entrance and enter ramp. Metro station behind hotel. Beds were very comfortable, bathroom was clean. Furnishings are shop worn; could use some up-grade or refinishing. Staff was very helpful with directions. Restaurant--pricey. Go to the "underground" adjacent to train station at Boneventure.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: angnufc
Reviews.Content: Well we stayed there for a conference which was held else where. Staff were very friendly and willing to help. Breakfast was ok good choice but everything tasted sweet. It's a bit out of the centre but a nice walk when the weather dry. Rooms look dated but guess it just there deco. Beds comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service - Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: TeamQuality
Reviews.Content: A real gem within the city. We checked in to the hotel on June 25 - arrived earlier than check in and without a question the room was ready. Saturday night there was a local prom in the hotel for their graduation dinner - and the lobby was a buzz with all the dresses and tuxedo's. The event itself was held in the lower lobby areas - never even a hint of problems with the group. I overheard a bellman/concierge speaking with a few of the grads and made them feel at home as well. The room was comfortable - and had everything that was require including free internet access. It was a great stay close to Old Montreal as well as the train station and the shopping!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, all you could want”
Reviews.Author: PhineusFlog
Reviews.Content: After a couple years at a different hotel, I was thrilled to get booked back into the Delta Centreville for Grand Prix weekend. For some reason this hotel just has everything. The staff is efficient, the underground parking is easy to access, the location is also easily accessible, the rooms are good sized and clean. Even with 1 elevator out of service, the other 5 more than made up for it and it was never a very long wait (walking 27 flights was out of the question). The breakfast buffet is very good, the coffee excellent, and the atmosphere buzzes.

Reviews.Title: “It's alright...”
Reviews.Author: Lambo999
Reviews.Content: Spent the week of June 6th for 4 nights at the Delta, the rooms might be a "little" outdated but not a big deal, as long as it's kept clean (room and bathroom) and the bed is comfortable which it was, I won't complain... I like the proximity to old MontrÃ©al also, after a long day of work it's very nice to take a stroll around Old MontrÃ©al and have something to eat... Salut

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: LakeIsland
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a conference. I had a king size bed that squeaked! I'm a small woman, 110lbs and this bed was squeaked every time I moved! Also had a super small tv in the room. Twice I went down to the restaurant for dinner and both times they were out of the only vegetarian item on the menu - lasagna. The 2nd time they at least offered and made me another pasta dish - nothing fancy but it worked and I wasn't charged the lasagna price for it. Overall it was fine but nothing special. Also hated the fact that wi-fi was only available in the lobby - that's a pain. Needs a face lift to be rated 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, good location”
Reviews.Author: GandC_UK
Reviews.Content: Huge city hotel, roms spacious and comfortable. Helpful bilingual staff. Good breakfast buffet at reasonable price for a city centre. Few minutes walk to Old Montreal and direct access to the underground city - path takes you through the centre of the restaurant. Free unlimited internet access in lobby only,may have to wait to find somewhere to sit , charge for wired access in room.The metro is good to get around - 8 CAD for a day pass. Need to circle the block to find the underground parking, safe and secure but costly.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay, very good location”
Reviews.Author: jason1975
Reviews.Content: stayed here with several couples in town for a wedding. the hotel is very central, 5 min walk to old montreal, 5 min walk the other way to shopping on rue saint catherine. the place was hopping, conventions, tour groups, etc. so it's a fairly lively place. indoor pool was warm and not crowded and had a nice walk out so you could take in the city. we had a great rate from hotwire and were satisfied with our room and it's 80's elegance ;), but didn't feel like we got "the hotwire rooms". parking, as in most cities, was expensive. however, if staying on a weekend, the underground lot across the street is only $10 night, and parking on the street is free overnight. i'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Garden18_5455
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the hotel, with a couple of friends. We spoke no French and were always 100% accommodated by the staff. Language was not an issue at the hotel, whatsoever. We arrived before lunch and were given an early entrance to our room. The heating in the room went wonky on day 3 but before we even had a chance to report it, the maid had an employee in and had it fixed in no time. The pool was lovely. The restaurant was great; food and service. We went to the revolving restaurant for brunch on Sunday and didn't realize we needed reservations...they were full but somehow managed to accommodate us. It was great. On day 4 when we were checking out, one of our party had a business conference call and the hotel accommodated that by giving us a late check out. Getting directions was no problem from the concierge, as a matter of fact one gentleman got directions, called the store and checked for the availability of the item I was looking for. Can't ask for better than that. I do have to note that the comments others were making about the ice machines were correct but I knew were to go looking before I got there (reviews are great). When I mentioned it to an employee, he suggested that the machine was empty because of the hockey team that was visiting. Time to fix the machines people. A pain to find ice but not the end of the world While our room was clean and comfortable, the door at some point had been broken in and it appears to have been repaired by a three year old. What I would expect to see in a seedy joint not a Delta. I think it was fixed with some kind of caulking or filler and then painted. A bit disconcerting. Overall, it was a good time, a good experience and I'd have no trouble recommending the Delta Centre-Ville to others. And as for all of those negative nellies who had nothing good to say, they're probably just unhappy people who would find something wrong no matter where they stayed. Looking for another excuse to go to Montreal and stay a the Delta Centre-Ville again.

Reviews.Title: “I always go back”
Reviews.Author: hrst
Reviews.Content: I am the kind of guy who works a lot and takes weekends off here and there to relax. I always end up booking @ Delta Centre Ville because the staff is very friendly and the location is amazing. I always take a Signature Club room and have no complaints other than the fact the rooms feel outdated (especially with those old TVs...) but at least they're spacious with a great view. Dining @ the Tour de Ville is a huge plus, the view at night is incredible to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Crimsonsketch
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I shared a room, and we were both disappointed, and downright shocked at times. The room was not kept up well at all. The doors were all sticking in their frames; It took all of my strength to open the closet door. The metal plug that was installed into the bathtub was half out and broken, and the following morning when we pulled our towels out for the shower, they were so worn that there were holes in them and all of the edges were frayed. We tried to watch a little TV before bed, and the TV cabinet doors wouldn't open all the way to allow both beds to see the TV. The shelf was supposed to pull out to adjust the view, but it was stuck and wouldn't move more than a few inches. To top it off, the beds were hard and the blankets were thin, making for a very cold night. We didn't bother to complain as we were just there for the one night, and would be checking out first thing in the morning, but I will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not accessible. Room broken into.”
Reviews.Author: Timber9762
Reviews.Content: I recently had the misfortune of staying at the Delta Cente-Ville several weeks ago for an accessibility workshop and was traveling with a disabled companion. We needed help simply getting in the front doors, as the main entrance is not accessible. Perfect for an accessibility conference, right? We were given an 'accessible room', which could only meet that definition because the room was large. My friend could not use the tub or shower, as - guess what? It was not accessible! She was not able to shower for three days. None of the washrooms off the conference centre were accessible, either, and we had to leave wheelchairs and scooters outside and physically help people into and out of these washrooms. Not a push-button opening anywhere. Shame on the Delta for not making this a priority. On a personal note, my room was adjacent to hers, but the bellman told us to simply close a second set of doors, then we would essentially have a suite, perfect for families or people traveling together. He neglected to tell us that there was a special way to lock this second door, and we found this out the hard way, when the next morning, while we were down for breakfast, our rooms were broken into, my purse and laptop stolen. I was gone from the room for less than forty minutes. Security was called, the police were called, but of course, since the room wasn't 'properly locked', there was nothing they could do. So I spent the rest of my time, without money, without ID, depending on the kindness of my colleagues. Some of the decor of the hotel is beautiful, but it is very much an old "gentelmen's club" style of hotel. The attitudes of the majority of the staff was condescending and aloof, so no, I'm afraid I cannot give this hotel a good rating at all.

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon experience - top notch service”
Reviews.Author: LovestotravelSK
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much to Dany and the guest services staff at the Delta Centre-Ville, we stayed here on the last night of our honeymoon and we were upgraded to a suite on the top floor that was out of this world, we were able to check in early and check out late to enjoy the last few hours of our vacation. On top of that we received complimentary chocolate dipped strawberries from the hotel. The room and amenities were great and you can access the metro without going outside which during our stay was quite nice. Would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “You can do much better for a lot less money.........”
Reviews.Author: johnneiliona
Reviews.Content: Went with some friends on Feb. 24/11 to see a couple of Canadiens games. The best rate we could get here was $161 per night plus taxes and fees. We checked in at 3pm and the room was absolutely disgusting. The game was at 7pm so we didn't have time to find another hotel. The carpet was so dirty that we wouldn't take our shoes off. There was what appeared to be dried blood on the bathroom floor. The window was leaking and making the carpet below it wet and there was a cigarette butt on the table by the ice bucket. I complained in the morning and we were given another room after much delay. This room was only adequate. It was clean but old. The televisions are about 10 or 15 years old and there is no wireless internet. Management offered us free breakfast for the remaining 2 days of our stay. However, they would not discount the price of our room for our inconvenience. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone (unless I hated them).........

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Good, AWFUL.”
Reviews.Author: thehabsfan
Reviews.Content: If you do not speak French (which is generally okay in Old Montreal) DO NOT STAY HERE. No concierge in what's supposed to be an above average establishment in a touristy region like Old Montreal? Oh okay, let's ask the staff. NOPE. After aimlessly pointing in a direction and spitting out a few words in an effort in what seemed like they were trying to get us to go away, I was actually told when wanting to go to the Bell Centre during the day, "oh, there's plenty of places to eat by the Bell Centre, you'll find something there", good luck, we ended up eating at La Cage aux Sports a place that's within the Bell Centre (only place we could really see that wasn't overly high end), separate issue, microwave tasting food. Being stubborn and fed up I would at times (on more than one occasion) go up 2 even 3 times to get directions to single places, spots even within the Metro, the actual maps in the Metro were more helpful than the staff. Also, as many other reviewers have noted, NO they do NOT honor reservations, we paid for a king, and they tried to put us up in 2 doubles (A COUPLE!), then argued with me about how it wasn't negotiated as I showed them A PRINTED PAPER OF MY RESERVATION FOR A KING, (with proof of said charge). I can stand a lot, and there are a few bad hotels I've stayed at, but most (not all) the staff was incredibly rude and unprofessional. Bell staff seemed polite enough, as was the bartender in my experience. Finally, no mini-fridges, okay, let's get ice. NUH UH. We were on floor 10, no ice (apparently, "all even number floors have ice here"), floor 4? No ice. Floor 6 had a 50% success rate, same day I got ice there, hours later, ice machine gone. Floor 8? Bingo, ice, the odyssey is over. Big hockey fan, maybe next time I'll stay at the Hilton across the street. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Great”
Reviews.Author: Nicole_1960
Reviews.Content: We planned a girl's weekend in Montreal and booked at the Delta Centre-ville. The location was great because we took the train to get there. We also wanted to walk around Old Montreal and it's located a few blocks from there. We had booked a message at the Spa located on the 4th floor of the hotel and just loved it. It was relaxing and just great. The room was big enough and clean, we were there to visit and relax and that's what we did, it was great. The check-in and check-out process was easy and quick. The service at the bar downstairs was great and the drinks were good. Overall we had a great time at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: rynamyn
Reviews.Content: Visited this hotel for two nights with my mom, we came by train & reaching the hotel was an easy walk. All employees were very polite but I agreed with a previous reviewer that they seemed a bit mechanical - only employee that showed any personality was the bellman on our last day, he made a few jokes & was very friendly. Room was very nice & quiet, decor was contemporary, bathroom was also nice, only minor issue I noticed was a small area on the ceiling in the bathroom where paint was peeling. Other than that very clean & in good condition. I was disappointed in the lack of Wifi internet, there was a plug-in internet option available but I was using a device that only had wifi capabilities. TV was kind of old but picture was still good & there was a good selection of channels. Location is good, you can walk to Ste Catherine or Old Montreal easily. If you go across the street to the Place Bonaventure you can access the extensive underground and don't have to go outside to reach the shopping centres near Ste Catherine (a big plus since we were there in January!) We had breakfast at the restaurant Chez Antoine & it was very good. We found a deal online for the hotel that included breakfast & some vouchers, 2nd night was half off so overall value was very good, would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Delta Privledge members didn't get upgraded”
Reviews.Author: lovesandalsnegril
Reviews.Content: Arrived by taxi to the Delta Centre-Ville which was the cheapest as we were two adults and one child ($38). The shuttle would be cheaper if you were travelling alone or with one other adult. Check-in was not flawless, we got our room keys and went up to our rooms which I noticed was not the Delta Privledge rooms (signature club rooms) and our keys did not work. I had to go back downstairs asked why our keys did not work and asked why we were not upgraded to the Signature Club rooms. They said the key was not programmed for the our room and that the upgraded signature club rooms were all closed. We were not informed of this previous and they told us that we were "upgraded" to the premiere rooms. The room was not an upgrade it was a downgrade as everything was old and worn out. The tub needed to be replaced badly. The beds were doubles, but were comfortable. There is no wireless internet in the rooms, but there was plug in to access the internet. Also, the signature lounge was closed as well and after asking for the second time why the signature rooms were not available. The reason was still not given, but they said the signature rooms were closed as well as the lounge since before the holidays. I found the reception desk not to be very friendly and willing to make our stay better. We did get complimentary breakfasts and water and fruit to our room which was nice, but I was hoping that our room would have been much nicer. We also tried the pool and I was shocked to see there was no hot tub. There is a life guard on duty at all times and thus limits the hours to the pool, so if you have kids please note the times of the pool hours. All in all we did have a have decent stay, but if I had it over again I probably would have stayed somewhere nicer. The location was the best thing it had going for it because you can take the metro from Park Victoria (under the hotel) and never step outside...which is very nice in the winter in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel ! But....”
Reviews.Author: Jeepmancrd
Reviews.Content: Stayed Here for UFC 124, for 4 days..... Great Hotel ! Excellent Location. Close to shopping, clubs, and restaurants. Great staff, clean and good facilities. Only down fall is there was no wireless internet in our room, and we had asked for a roll away bed as we had 3 in our room, and they would not give us one sighting "security reasons" I have no idea what that was supposed to mean. But wasnt impressed

Reviews.Title: “A whole lot of OK”
Reviews.Author: ChequeMark
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal on business and decided on giving the Delta a try. While not disappointed with the experience, I was not impressed either. The check in at the front desk was very mechanical, polite but no feeling of warmth or careing. The room itself was also OK, or decent size but the finishes were dated and showed wear. The bed was comfortable and I had a reasonable nights sleep. I can not find fault in any particular area it was just a very average experience. There are better hotels in the area for the same money that will go the extra mile to make their customers feel welcome. I will stay at these before returning to this Delta.

Reviews.Title: “Great bed - fast check in - even with what looked like a big line-up”
Reviews.Author: DB1988
Reviews.Content: Great value if booked on-line. Efficient service, very clean and our room on the 21st floor had a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: DLWhite
Reviews.Content: The Delta was a great surprise! Althought the previous reviews were mixed, we discovered the Delta Centre-Ville Hotel to be a great experience. The rooms were clean, staff was friendly and helpful, and the location near the heart of downtown and hockey arena was perfect. Would recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Potential”
Reviews.Author: AlandDiane
Reviews.Content: We arrived in late afternoon on a Sunday and left in the morning on Monday. So, we really did not have an opportunity to explore the underground [closes about 5:30pm on Sunday we were told]. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, the air conditioning didn't work that well but was livable, the informal restaurant was good for a quick dinner and the buffet breakfast in the same venue the next day was good. Since we had spent the afternoon in the old section of Montreal, we were just chilling. So, I would come back to this hotel and give it another run.

Reviews.Title: “overall really nice stay if you get the $109 deal”
Reviews.Author: traveltdot
Reviews.Content: We decided on a last minute trip to Montreal during the thanksgiving weekend. Stayed for four nights at the Delta centre ville. Great location. Five minutes from Old Montreal less than five minutes from St. Catherines. We got a room upgrade as our room wasn't ready when we checked in. Room was spacious, king bed was great. Nice and quiet part of the hotel. We were in room 1915. The so so part of the hotel is that the room could use an update. Curtains, carpet, furnishings all fine but sort of late 80-90s era. I am sensitive to light and although they had black out curtains, they didn't cover the entire window. I rigged it up so that the floor lamp would keep the curtains back and I used a chair on the other side. It was a bit of a pain the first morning but it wasn't a problem after I rigged everything up for the rest of my stay. Wall paper in the bathroom is peeling off and the vent isn't working. All small things that did not wreck my stay but things they could improve on. We did a short workout one morning. Gym is fine, pool is small and the saunas are in the dressing rooms. We never ate at the hotel but we did order room service for breakfast and drinks. Room service was fine. I was expecting to be charged for internet service but they didn't charge us. Perhaps this is part of the upgrade? Parking is $ 25 a day. I liked this hotel a lot but had I paid the full price I am not sure I would have choose this place. The best thing about this hotel is the location and great bed. Overall I did enjoy my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Allo3
Reviews.Content: When we learned that the Delta Centre Ville had accepted our Priceline bid we had mixed feelings partly attributable to reviews here. We were also discouraged when our confirmation was listed as a king smoking room. (We were traveling with our daughter and are non-smokers) I called the hotel to request a change to a nonl-smoking room with double beds and got a discouraging response reminding me that there are no guarantees with Priceline. We are frequent visitors to Montreal and prefer to stay closer to Downtown than to Old Montreal so that was another concern. We needn't have worried!! We were greeted warmly. Our non-smoking room with double beds was waiting when we arrived and since we are Delta Privelege members and check-in took longer than 3 minutes, we were offered vouchers for one full breakfast. Priceline was never mentioned at check in and our room location was perfect--away from noisy elevators and ice machines. The walk to Ste. Catherine Street was closer than I thought and we even found free parking immediately around the hotel for all three nights which saved us $22 per night. Even if that had not been the case, both Montreal Delta hotels provide self-park garages with unlimited in and out--a big and unusual convenience in Montreal. Beds were very comfortable and the room was clean and well-kept. The doors could use a little sprucing up but nobody's perfect. Don't hesitate to book a room here. I'm not sure what the breakfast buffet would have cost, but we were very pleasantly surprised at the quality of the food. Coffee and juice arrived as soon as we were seated and the buffet included plenty of meats, eggs, omelets, breads, fruit, and much more. We were on a tight schedule on checl-out day which is when we decided to use our vouchers and were not delayed for a second by slow service. We travel a lot and have little patience for bad service or facilities. Also, since we rely a great deal on Trip Advisor reviews we feel an obligation to report our experiences accurately. This was a good one.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic location for business travellers”
Reviews.Author: mustafaetkarim
Reviews.Content: in the heart of the city center and close to major business headquarters ( ICAO, BURSE, ERNEST&YOUNG) 4 mins walk to the central rail station and three underground connected shopping centers. Overall good hotel but some rooms need renovation. Staff are friendly and room service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lt_zippy2
Reviews.Content: A great room with a wonderful view. Good facilities and food. Ideal location with easy access to the Old Town and Downtown. No problems with booking, check in or out! A great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Expect a 3.5 star hotel and you'll be satisfied”
Reviews.Author: mpdesjardins
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there. My detailed comments go as follows: *ROOM: The hotel offers are 3 different room classes: Delta (their cheapest), Premier and Signature Club rooms. All rooms are of the same size but Signature Club and Premier rooms are located on higher floors. Signature Club rooms are the most expensive and include many additional amenities such as a 24h access to the Signature Club Lounge (30th floor), complimentary high-speed internet access, bathrobes, an IPod dock station, cordless phone... My girlfriend and I got a Signature Room. The hotel's official website say all rooms are "spacious". I wouldn't say so. 300-350 square foot is not claustrophobic but not spacious. Also, when the most exciting piece of furniture in your room is a tufted armchair (without a footrest), you know that the overall wow-factor is low. Nothing ugly but very generic decor. The view on downtown Montreal was nice, though. I also saw a Delta Room (which was occupied by somebody else in our party). It looked exactly the same as our Signature Room except for dated bedspreads. Bathrooms were quite okay in both rooms. Nothing to mention, except some problems with door locks. For a 4-star hotel, I am surprised that there was no mini-fridge in the room. No safe neither. *CLEANLINESS: No problem here as far as I'm concerned. *SIGNATURE LOUNGE: Nice views, some comfortable couches, no atmosphere whatsoever. Signature Room guests get the complimentary continental breakfast. Bread, bagels, cereals, fruits, some cheese, muffin and pastries. No hot plates (eggs, bacon, sausages). Between 5-7, hors d'oeuvres are served (for free). They are tasty and of good quality overall. Good service from the staff at breakfast time. I have one complaint though. During our whole stay, they kept the lounge temperature so LOW it was impossible to fully enjoy the place. The first thing you noticed upon entering the lounge was how cold it was (I'd say below 18 Celsius). I had to ask three different staff members to fix the problem. The first one ignored my request. The second one said : "You're cold? I feel ok..." and walked away (!). The third one seemed to fix the problem but it remained as cold as always. Conclusion: staff members don't seem to have any idea about how to adjust room temperature. They don't seem to care neither. *RESTAURANTS / BARS: There are two restaurants and one bar at the hotel. "Chez Antoine" is the lobby restaurant and bar. I haven't tried the restaurant, although I took a look at the menu card and the food selection seemed uninteresting and on the pricey side. The bar section of the restaurant is nothing like your typical 4-star hotel bar (at least not in 2010). Poor lighting, old mismatched chairs and couches, insufficient / overwhelmed staff with poor attitude, slow service and ridiculously overpriced food (would you pay 5.50 $ for two slices of cheese or 14$ for a regular hamburger?). However, you might want to try the revolving rooftop restaurant, le Tour de Ville (30th floor). Yes, it's very expensive, but I've only heard positive comments about it. *POOL / GYM FACILITIES: The pool is clean but very small. No hot tub. Changing rooms are awful. I'm pretty sure nothing in there has ever been changed or refreshed since the disco era. Shower partitions are rusty at the bottom and the tiles have seen better days. Walls are covered with pale green tiles that make the place look like an old operating room. Not 4-starish. Like all the rest, the sauna is old but was in good working order during my stay. The fitness room is well equipped and clean. *STAFF: Front-desk and lounge staff were quite nice and helpful overall. *PARKING: Didn't use it so I can't say anything about it. *LOCATION: At walk distance to many hot spots (Central Station, Bell Center, Place Bonaventure, Ste-Catherine St. ...). The hotel is directly linked to the Square-Victoria subway station, which is a plus. *CHECK-IN / CHECK-OUT: I'm not the one who checked in but check-out was very smooth. One interesting feature of this hotel chain is that Delta Privilege members (you can enroll for free) can get early check-in as early as 8 am (instead of 3-4 pm) and late check-out as late as 6 pm (instead of noon). We got the 6 pm check-out and it makes a world of difference! I think that feature is really worth mentioning, and I'm not sure whether all hotel chains provide such convenient perks to ALL of their members (I'm no "Diamond-Platinum-Gold-Super-Elite" member at all). *GENERAL COMMENTS: This hotel looks nice and has a rather unique late-70s architecture. It's generally comfortable and always clean. There are some problems but they won't ruin your stay unless you expect a cutting-edge 4-star hotel. I'd rate it 3.5 stars. Regular prices for standard rooms (no promo code, no Hotwire/Priceline) are generally kept between 110 and 200 $ depending on the season, which is honest.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good value!”
Reviews.Author: JP58964
Reviews.Content: Small room, no mini bar and no service after 11:25, for 200$ /night you can get so much better at other hotel and with better location, absolutly nothing that is walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Reaonable Hotel but needs updating.”
Reviews.Author: alanp_117
Reviews.Content: The Hotel isn't bad, but it needs updating, the one of the down buttons on the lifts on the 20th floor had been removed and not replaced and the bath fitting was hanging out of its proper place. Restaurant is good and the staff were excellent to deal with.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Near everything, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: hockeykidtaveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this Hotel when I took my gf to see a Habs game, we stayed for 2 nights and it was amazing how good everything was from the food to the service we really enjoyed the stay we checked in after midnight as our train got in really late and they even let us extend out stay by a couple hours so we didnt have to be out of the room until our train left. For the price and location this hotel is an amazing deal you should check it out if you are looking for a nice place at a decent price

Reviews.Title: “On the edge of all amenities”
Reviews.Author: pinpongcrazy
Reviews.Content: About 5 minutes walk downhill from the central station. Smart check in hall, but our room not ready. we were given a couple of vouchers for drinks in the bar. Check in also gave us a map with shopping and tousist areas highlighted and a few recommended reastaurants. The room was large and clean and adequately eqipped. The bathroom looks a bit tired and could do with a refurb and redoration. We had access to the signature club lounge and an adequate continental breakfast and hors d'hourves between 5 and 7 First night we dined at the very good Pyrennes in Rue St Paul about a 10 mins stroll.Promenade and piers about 15 mins, Basilica and shops about the same. Check out quick and efficient and questions answered by the concierge without a problem. Very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: lchiassondavid
Reviews.Content: For a Delta hotel it needs a lot of upgrading. When we first arrived, the room was in bad condition. There was only one chair to sit down so we went to reception desk and asked for a second chair. When we got back to the room they had delivered a conference/banquety chair. We were staying there for 4 days and also had to work during those 4 days. It would have been nice to be able to relax in the room as well. When we mentionned this to reception we were told that they did not renovate smoking rooms which is quite descriminating. Also when the room was booked it was asked that something special be put in the room since it was booked by brother in law (delta employee) and it wasn't.done. The sink in the bathroom was cracked and the furniture was shabby. We were also told when the reservations were done that it would include complimentary breakfast which it wasn't either. We were very disappointed in the quality and service of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Manager Dany - Excellent Manager, Kind and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: FourFenwicks
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have always wanted to visit Montreal and finally decided to do so with another couple. As we have always stayed at the Delta Ottawa (Lynn is GREAT, as well as Lori!!!) we were looking SOOOO forward to our visit to Montreal, knowing the hotel would be wonderful. Unfortunately, our new truck was broken into in the underground parking (smashed window) and we had to spend much of our weekend chasing down replacement glass, and arranging pick-up, etc. Thus we did not get to see the Cathedral, China Town, nor the Archeological museum, three of the things that drew us to Montreal. I cannot stress enough how INCREDIBLE Dany Dubois (manager) was in accommodating our ill fortune. He went so far above and beyond the call of duty both before and after the break-in that we all enjoyed ourselves in spite of the incident. He should truly be commended, what a shining example of an employee who TRULY cares about the image of his employer and his hotel. A fine man, and a fine manager. We received excellent service as well from David in security (he allowed us to move the truck to the loading dock for safe keeping) and Cassandra at the front desk. It takes a lot of excellent people to make up for such an unfortunate incident. These people did just that. We hope to return to see the attractions we missed. In regards to the break in: Keep your electronics out of plain sight, and DONT PARK ON THE STREET, especially if you have out of province plates! This part of Montreal is GORGEOUS, but the auto theft and smash-grabs like ours are always an issue. Plan. All the surveillance cameras in the world will not prevent this, you need to be smart. In regards to the town: visit Old Montreal, taking a night stroll while checking out the menus on display outside all these fabulous restaurants. The lighting is very european and the old architecture wears it well, Use the ambiance of the old cobble stone streets and dim alleys to slow your life down some. We all need more of this.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Nice Part of Montreal”
Reviews.Author: kobidor
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here three nights while in Montreal. We loved being within walking distance of Old Montreal and lots of great restaurants. The hotel was very nice, although the desk and shelves in the bathroom were showing a bit of wear. However, our room was clean, large and inviting. Our biggest complaint: No free internet! (Also, parking was very expensive, but that's what happens when you stay in a big city!) It was a conference center so it didn't have the charm that I'm sure other hotels in Montreal have, but it was in a nice, safe part of town and centrally located. It was a good place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Memorable”
Reviews.Author: bigtim116
Reviews.Content: There wasn't a whole lot that made this place stand out from any other hotel I've been to. The place could stand to be renovated- the room showed signs of years of wear- the furniture needed reupholstery, the bathroom fixtures were quite old, carpets were worn. Nothing was in terrible condition- it was just below the standard of places that I've been to on recent trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very good service in remarkably quiet Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Disco_David
Reviews.Content: We went to the Delta Centre Ville over the long weekend to attend a CFL football game. We stayed for a total of 4 nights and toured Montreal. Arrival - we flew on a red eye so we were at the hotel in the morning well before our check in time. The found a room that was ready and checked us in right away which was great. The bell staff were very helpful with our bags and directing us to parking. Their parking system is a little convoluted with you getting a ticket, having to get it validated at the front desk before you leave. When you leave you go through one gate and have to pick up a second ticket to get out. It is a little confusing but nothing awful. This is one hotel I might go for the valet parking in. The bell staff offered excellent advice on restaurants and attractions. The room- The room was average sized but had all the basic amenities, internet, coffee maker, TV etc. The best thing about it, we didn't hear a sound while we were sleeping! Right in downtown and it was very quiet. Housekeeping - the housekeepers seemed to clean the room almost as soon as we left and, as it was the long weekend, it was busy. In addition, they were very friendly and helpful with finding ice etc. There was even ice in the ice bucket in the evenings. Restaurant - we went to the restaurant for breakfasts and dinner. The a la carte breakfast made very good pancakes with a bit of a crepe style. Very tasty. The buffet was your normal fare. Ok but nothing spectacular. The dinner was very good. I am used to hotels aiming at bland food. The meal we had was tasty and well prepared. The server was very friendly. Location - the hotel is within reasonable walking distance of Old Montreal, downtown, a metro station and many services. We found it very convenient for touring the city. Check out - our flight didn't leave until the evening and we had no problems arranging late checkout as the room was available. Best part of this hotel, quiet rooms, helpful staff. Downsides, parking kind of sucked and rooms were a little small. I will stay here again when I go to Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Great sleep”
Reviews.Author: lynn078
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better Delta Hotels we've encountered. It was clean, the staff were friendly, and it's in a great location. We'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Holiday-Lady25
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great really enjoyed my stay. The location was fab and was only a short walk to the shops underground which was heaven. The restaurtant on the top floor is a must do and is great as it's a buffer so it pleases everyone. The rooms were great I had a great big one at one of the ends which also had good views of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Service, Accomodations, Amenities, and Value!”
Reviews.Author: artbrutnewyork
Reviews.Content: This hotel's location is excellent, situated within walking distance of Vieux Montreal and a few blocks from the downtown center which has nice shops, restaurants, entertainment options. So it has a vibrant energy surrounding it. The hotel itself is well maintained, the staff are polite and accommodating. The rooms were large and clean, hallways were immaculate. This is a place where you get good value for your money. This was a very enjoyable stay and look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Average”
Reviews.Author: B_in_Ottawa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed three nights at the Delta Centre-Ville. We booked a room in the Signatures Club floor. Our room was clean and a decent size. The bed was comfortable and the shower had very good pressure despite being on a high floor. The TV, though, was old and the room could use some new paint. The internet access was fast. The gym was decent, but not overly big. The continental breakfast that came with our room rate was good. However, if you arrive towards the latter part of breakfast, don't expect much variety. In terms of location, the hotel is well located, on the edges of Old Montreal and near the Metro. I would give this hotel 3.5 stars, but opted for four since I cannot provide a 1/2 star.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this dated and tired hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelover02
Reviews.Content: This hotel has very little to recommend it. It is not well maintained and the service is unacceptable. Our room was not ready even though we were checking in at the prescribed time of 3pm. We were told to come back in an hour; whereas a complemtary drink or coffee would have been a much nicer offer. There is only one restaurant and it is overpriced and of low quality. The rooms are a bit larger than average, but the cooling and heating system is quite noisy and woke us up one night. The TV was very old and the wand did not work. The carpet had stains, and the furniture was battered and worn. The gym area is small but ok; the pool is small and very chlorinated. This is not a cheap hotel, and definitely not good value. Overall, the hotel needs a rethink in terms of service, food and level of comfort. Avoid this hotel if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: World_Citizen8
Reviews.Content: I am reading some reviews and they are quite different from my own experience. I was pleased with my stay at the Delta Centre-Ville. The furniture in my room was relatively new, the bathroom recently refurbished, the carpet did not smell, the towels were ok, etc. I have no complaint except for the bed which was a bit too soft for my taste. When I reserved from the hotel's own website there was an option to get a room upgrade for something like $20 which I selected. Perhaps this accounts for the nicer room than some other reviewers describe. To be fair many Montreal hotels were built in the 1960s and have not been redecorated since then. When it comes to overall hotel quality Montreal is nothinh like Dubai or Tokyo or Shanghai.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JeffkVancouver
Reviews.Content: This is a nice location and the service is very nice. I would recommend this for both Business and pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of refurbishing”
Reviews.Author: Annick9
Reviews.Content: Cons: no safe, smelly carpets, bathroom not up to par, banged up furniture, lousy shower products. Pro: adequate location, the hotel of the conferenced I attended. In more details: As I walked in the Delta Centre Ville with 2 heavy suitcases, the doormen let me battle with the TWO heavy double doors, and only came to life after I got in the lobby! I thought at this point that it did not bode well. When I first walked in my room (high floor) on a fairly chilly day, I had to turn the A/C on just to get rid of the musty smell coming from the carpet. Needless to say, I never walked barefoot on that floor! The smell subsided whenever I turned the A/C off. There was no safe in the room so I got to lug my valuables all around Montreal all the time. Oh joy of traveling in such conditions!! The TV cabinet must have been banged in by a previous guest since the door could not stay entirely open and the hinges looked a bit torn on one side. The bathroom had been cleaned but obviously needed refurbishing. There were a lot of black mildew marks in between the tiles. In one word: AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Awesomely close to La Ronde!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulPendon
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and a few friends of mine booked 2 rooms here and were impressed! The front lobby is exquisite and the staff were very friendly accommodating to our requests. We were able to get early check-in at 12pm, our rooms beside each other, and quite a bit away from the very quick elevators. The rooms themselves were sufficient for what we needed and very quiet. The air conditioning was top notch and worked well...especially in the recent heat wave that passed through. The water pressure in the shower was a little weak and the drain looked to be jutting out a bit; the included soap and shampoo were very nice. Plenty of towels in the washroom and a few extra blankets and pillows in the massive walk-in closet. Comfortable mattresses and 2 chairs and 2 tables are always a nice touch in a base level room. The underground parking lot is a bit cramped and can turn into a small maze to get out of - 22$ for overnight...the public underground lot across the street was 20$ so save that twoonie if you really want to. For us, the best part was the location. Very close to Saint Helen's Island which has La Ronde amusement park! After spending a full day of rollercoasters and walking around in heat, it was nice to quickly come back to a freezing cold room and comfortably lounge. Would recommend for party nights/La Ronde trips and would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwficon
Reviews.Content: Great central location, with the waterfront one way and the main shopping hub the other. Looks great from the outside, and very welcoming inside. Very helpful staff. I had a good sized room with a great bathroom. Would definately stay here again if I'm ever back in Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommended”
Reviews.Author: tugflorida
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Montreal, the staff were very friendly and helpful, check-in was quick despite the fact we stayed on a busy holiday weekend plus Hockey team were in town. Good facilities - fitness centre, swimming pool, restaurant staff very good specially for meal requests not listed on menu. Hotel location walking distance of couple minutes to station, a short walk to the Basilica, and the Old Port, Rue St Catherine etc. Sightseeing bus collects at Hotel door, this hotel is ideal for all age groups.

Reviews.Title: “friendly and clean”
Reviews.Author: nutmeg66
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from our 1st trip to Montreal, The food was lovely and the staff were very friendly and helpful. We went to see the F1 and stayed on longer to take in the sights of Montreal. We had a great experiance, being F1 fans it was great to have the Ferrari team (not drivers) and bridgestone team stayin there at the same time...was fantastic, even though we are not Ferrari fans. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable even though they are not as big as we normally get in the USA. the fact that you could get to the metro and the shopping via our hotel was a plus when it was raining. what ever we needed you only had to ask and they did all they could to accomadate us. we would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not impressed”
Reviews.Author: maple_ny
Reviews.Content: Back to Montreal where I was born after many years we decided to stay at the Delta Centre Ville hotel. We had a room on a high floor which was great because the view was amazing. The room by itself was quite large and the bed was ok but nothing extraordinary. The front desk staff is not over friendly, the check-in and check-out were a little bit robotic. The price paid was a little high for what we got but it was a last minute reservation. I guess we could have a better rate if reserved well in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, starting to show some wear, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: nobo
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, between two Metro stations and walking distance from many things - Palais des congres, Centre Bell, St. Catherine St., etc. Staff was, however, not particularly friendly or helpful. They tried to give me a smoking room when I checked in. My room was clean and had a nice view, but actually did smell like a smoking room. Yes, service in Montreal restaurants is slower than elsewhere in North America, however the restaurant here takes this to a new level. After waiting for at least 45 minutes for my lunch, I was brought the wrong dish, and when noted the the error to the server, he argued with me. On the four occasions I went to the restaurant and bar, I was only made to feel welcome once. The gift shop has posted hours until 11:00 p.m., but on one evening when I really needed to buy something, they closed 5 to 10 minutes early. The bell staff was very friendly and helpful though, and I did enjoy my stay, particularly considering the $99 rate I had found. However, this was my first stay in a Delta, and I don't think that the standard of service is enough to make me seek out the brand in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad, Not Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: rpt319
Reviews.Content: I had traveled with my parents to Montreal for a week and stayed at the Delta Centre-Ville as that is where my Mom's conference was. The hotel wasn't terrible, but there were a few things that bugged me about it. My Mom had thought she had booked a two queen bed room, but turned out it was a two double bed room. It was fine for me, but for my parents sharing a bed was a little cramped. The room is dated, as the door has a chain on it, not a proper deadbolt. The TV was stuck in a cabinet and as a result was hard to see from the far side of the room. As mentioned in other reviews, they need to have window washers as the window was dirty on the outside. The biggest problem with the room, was anytime anyone in another room flushed their toilet, ours gurggled and made a racket. Not the best for sleeping when someone uses theirs at 2 AM. The underground parking is a bit of a pain and technically a rip-off. As it has a hotel guest area and a public area, if you park in the public area it is $20 for a day whereas the hotel charges $22. So if you are planning on spending a day walking and don't need in and out priviledges that day, park in the public lot. As well, the ceilings are very low and as I am a tall man, there was places where I had to duck. Also, they cram the cars in to the point where the stalls are difficult to manoeuver in. Lastly, the slightly annoying "double ticket" system is a pain. All hotel guests have one ticket that if you pay their rate are validated for the day. However, to exit the garage, you need to take a second ticket from the public gate and you are given 10 minutes free to exit. The worst part of the hotel is the restaurant. Now granted, my complaint seems to simply be a factor of Quebec culture as it was like this everywhere. But the service stunk, I guess in Quebec you are supposed to spend 2 hours or more at every meal. We ate at the lobby restaurant twice and both times, the food took nearly half an hour. It's not like we ate steaks and lobster, it was merely hamburgers. The other issue I had was how the staff didn't seem to check on you. We'd order and the food would come eventually, but at least here in Saskatchewan, the staff would be back to see how it was tasting. The waiters never did this, we were left with the used dishes sitting on the table for awhile before anyone came by to collect the plates. The plus sides of the hotel are located near the major tourist destination and is attached to the RESO so traveling around Montreal is easy. There is a store that sells what I term "event du jour" merchandise. We arrived on Sunday evening after the F1 race and the store was stocked with a selection of both general race merchandise and specific team merchandise. When we checked out on Friday, it had World Cup merchandise. The giftshop also carried a wide variety of English and French newspapers and a selection of magazines. They also have free internet stations set up in the lobby, which supposedly have 15 minute time limits, but they were not strictly enforced. All in all, I would stay at the Delta again, but I'd likely try and stay on a high floor. I assume like most hotels, the higher the floor, the better the room. Staying on the first floor of rooms obviously meant we had the cheapest and least renovated rooms in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “They don't honour your reservation”
Reviews.Author: liu2577
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with Delta! I reserved and paid for a King bed room and received a twin share double bed, when I enquired, I was told they were too busy (F1 was on) and had no rooms available, despite my reservation months ago. When I checked online, they still had 2 King bed rooms available for sale, again, I enquired and they told me that because it was online doesn't necessarily mean that they were available (I precisely entered the dates of my stay). I think this is misleading to consumers and want people to be aware of how they do business. So not only was I not happy for not getting what I paid for, I was placed next to the lifts and didn't sleep the 3 nights I was there. Service was pretty bad too. My husband went downstairs to the bar for a beer and after 20 mins waiting and no service, he left without his beer! No concierge to service you either, you are pretty much left on your own. For a hotel that is rated 4 stars on Booking.com I expected much better. The beds are very comfortable, one plus at least! I would not recommend it and I will not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay for Leisure”
Reviews.Author: FrizzyNY5
Reviews.Content: It was my first real time in Montreal and I definitely wanted to spend it at a hotel that was nice. As shown on their website, the hotel is very nice. The room was very clean and the service was great. Being from America, the staff was very accommodating and spoke very fluent English. I parked my car in their parking lot, and although it was very hot, my car stayed safe for the three nights we were there. There is a bar and restaurant in the hotel. We didn't really expect to eat there, but when we asked if it was open we were told it was only open on the weekends. Had breakfast in their lobby floor restaurant and it sucked. But if the coffee was the worst part of this trip, then I would definitely recommend this hotel. The only disappointment was the pool. The website picture is relatively misleading. It looks like a large sized pool when in fact it was rather small. Of course there were a lot of children being obnoxious which didn't help. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Great deal for a 3 1/2 star hotel and in a perfect location for all of Montreal's nightlife.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Franckmtl
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great staff...WOW nice revolving restaurant with delicious buffet...romantic experience!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, but lacked charm”
Reviews.Author: TDinallo
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right off of Route 720 and is in good proximity to the Bell Centre, St. Catherine's Street, the Casino and Old Montreal. I never waited once for a taxi and there is also a Bixi station (Montreal's rent a bike program) a block away, so transportation is ample. The room was very clean and the beds were amazingly comfortable. The pool has a lifeguard on duty, there are single sex saunas and the fitness room is very accessible. That said, the service was lacking. I tried to make arrangements for an early check in and the front desk didn't seem to make any effort to try and accommodate them. Also, I waited about 10 minutes each time to valet my car while they helped several guests who arrived after me. Another con for this hotel is no complimentary breakfast in the morning or reception hour in the evening. If you aren't looking for any of this, then the Delta would be a good choice. However, if you like to relax and feel like you are being taken care of while on vacation, then I would direct you to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: lovlilynne
